title: Business Banker (Remote - Boise, ID, Vancouver, WA & Portland, OR)
description:
More than 130 years ago, we started with core values that never go out of style: listen, learn and help businesses and individuals reach their goals. Our financial strength and stability are key reasons Forbes names us one of the Best 100 Banks in America the past five years.  

With more than $16 billion in assets and over 150 locations throughout Washington, Oregon, Idaho, and California, we understand our role in the economy and take that responsibility seriously. In addition to offering a source of capital to personal banking clients and businesses of all sizes, we place a high importance on employee volunteerism and donate millions of dollars each year to community organizations.  

As a Business Banker with Banner Bank you will grow Business Banking revenue by increasing business deposits, loans, treasury management, and merchant services. Primary focus is on the acquisition of new bank client relationships.
### **In this role you will have the opportunity to:**

* Actively develop and manage relationships with high value business clients. Promoting and marketing a broad range of bank products and services.
* Develop and maintain necessary relationships with line of business partners, commercial relationship managers, branch managers, and related staff to facilitate a team environment and successful delivery of products and services.
* Responsible for meeting sales volume and profitability goals, sales activities, and calling goals.
* Develop internal and external referral sources through centers of influence, participation in bank events, community activities, and participation in seminars for professional and small business groups.
* Understanding all company products and making referrals to other areas as appropriate.
* Coordinate and set up meetings between prospective customers and appropriate line of business partners, including Commercial Relationship Managers, Branch Managers, Treasury Management Representatives, Mortgage Loan Officers, Investment Officers, and Outside Affiliated Product Reps.
* Responsible for complying with policies, procedures, security requirements, and government regulations.

### **Education & Certifications**

* Bachelor's Degree: Accounting, Business, Economics, Law, Computer Science or other related field required (an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered)

### **Experience**

* 6 or more years of experience in business banking required

### **Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

* Proven ability to develop business relationships.
* Possess strong networking and relationship management skills.
* Possess effective presentation and negotiation skills.
* Possess a working knowledge and understanding of cash management products and services.
* Knowledge of federal and state laws and regulations relating to commercial lending.

### **Travel**

* 20%

### **Compensation & Benefits**

* Targeted starting salary range (based on experience): $80,000 – $90,000
* Robust uncapped quarterly incentive plan
* Comprehensive employee benefits, including: medical, dental, vision, LTD, STD and life
* Paid vacation time, sick time and 11 company paid holidays
* 401k (with up to 4% match)
* Tuition reimbursement up to $5,250 annually
* Get more information at: Employee Benefits \\u007C Banner Bank


Please take time to review Banner Bank's Consent & Privacy notice before applying.  

Banner Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, marital status, age, disability or protected veteran status. **Banner Bank does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for any job postings** on this site. Resumes submitted to any Banner Bank employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written and signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Banner Bank. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for a position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral.

title: Post-Closing Processor
description:
**Come help us change residential real estate investing for the better!** **Backflip** is a venture-backed **FinTech** company that **empowers anyone to improve their life and their neighborhood through real estate investing**. To do that, we need people who are inspired to reimagine and rebuild an outdated and unbalanced system; to support and celebrate America’s local entrepreneurs (our "Members").  

Backflip is seeking a **Post-Close Processor** to join our Post-Close Experience Team to ensure Backflip delivers a best-in-class Member experience. As an early hire, this individual will play a critical role in ensuring Backflip has an industry leading Member Success function that is designed to scale. This hire will play a key role in ensuring Backflip’s culture continues to be enlivened in the operation.  

We’re looking for candidates who possess strong technical and communication skills with a passion for facilitating an exceptional Member journey, and thrive in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment. Success in this role requires learning quickly while balancing structure and autonomy. This position is remote (U.S.) and reports to the Sr. Director of Loan Operations. This is a rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor (~50 person team) working directly with senior leaders in a fast-paced and well-capitalized startup (Series A).  

Some travel is required (e.g. - company offsites).
### **This candidate will champion Backflip’s culture & Core Values:**

* **Raise the standard** of what is possible
* **Embrace** being **the novice** to become the master
* Work only with those who want the best for us
* **Communicate** quickly, naturally and with radical candor
* **Learn** **from** the **giants** who came before us
* **Try new things** in pursuit of invention

### **Primary Responsibilities**

* Proactively manage the post-close pipeline to ensure each Member feels valued, empowered, and is set up for success
* Process rehab draws utilizing our software platform, including coordinating progress inspections and serving as the Member point of contact
* Manage a loan payoff pipeline by tracking requests and facilitating the preparation of payoff statements in a timely manner
* Process loan extension requests in collaboration with Backflip's Asset Management team
* Communicate proactively with Members to get ahead of issues and protect Backflip’s loan performance track record
* Effectively handle Member escalations, as applicable
* Provide each Member with a welcome call upon their loan closing
* Uphold communication SLA’s; ensure borrowers receive timely responses
* Work with the broader team to develop opportunities to engage Members with Community and Product
* Support Backflip’s Capital Markets team to complete related processing tasks and resolve investor conditions

 *This role will evolve as the company grows; there will be various tasks that fall outside of the responsibilities above.*### **Qualifications - Role Specific**

* 2+ years of experience in a customer service position
* 1+ year of experience in a mortgage or FinTech operations role
* Experience with short-term bridge loans or construction loans is a plus
* Passionate about the Member Experience; energized by building healthy customer relationships
* Interest in real estate investing and excited about understanding our member’s investment journey
* Prior work at a high-growth start-up is a plus
* Experience with real estate renovations and project management is a plus
* General understanding of basic real estate investment concepts (or demonstrated desire to learn); comfortable performing basic math calculations
* Exemplary computer skills - demonstrated ability and desire to learn new technologies (we use Slack + Notion + Google Workspace + Front + HubSpot + more)
* Basic spreadsheet skills (Excel; Google Sheets)

### **People That Thrive at Backflip Have…**

* A desire to learn and grow with the company; propensity to “think like an owner”
* An execution-oriented “one-team” mindset with motivation and scrappiness to achieve objectives
* The ability to multi-task with exceptional time management, prioritization and attention to detail
* An entrepreneurial mindset and a passion for technology and innovation
* The ability to work effectively in a small, relatively unstructured office environment (we work remotely)
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with appropriate urgency to various audiences
* Strong self-motivation, are coachable and highly collaborative; they take ownership of tasks and pride in work product; details matter
* High integrity; are dependable, accountable, humble and respectful
* The Compensation figure above includes Base Salary + Performance Bonus, and is based on a variety of factors including prior experience. In addition to a competitive market salary, Backflip employees receive equity stock options, 100% paid health care, a 401K + company match, among other industry-leading benefits.


All Backflip positions are Remote. Like the people we serve, we believe being free to create wherever you’re most inspired is one of life’s greatest joys. It’s better for individuals, for the community, and for fostering great work to emerge. With our work-from-anywhere approach, **Backflip brings together a diverse team of individuals, with passions for innovation, art, coding, AI, data, finance, film, real estate, the environment, learning and teaching**. Together, we're moving fast.  

Backflip is an equal opportunity employer. We know that **building a world-class organization is not possible without an intentional focus on recruiting, empowering, promoting and rewarding the best and brightest people of all backgrounds.** Backflip focuses on hiring individuals that align with its Core Values (listed above), and consistently display a high ethical standard, both personally and professionally.  

Check out this page to learn more about building a career at Backflip.  

\\uD83D\\uDC47 Disclosures:
This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship

title: Mortgage Compliance Specialist
description:
Champions Mortgage has been ranked as the Top Mortgage company in Texas for the past 5+ years! Our core principles of Honesty, Integrity, and Commitment to Success are validated by the 250+ 5-star google reviews on our business page! We earned the award for the 'Best Mortgage Company' in Houston by Five Star Professionals in 2021 and 2022. Our mortgage broker, Joel Mathew, has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as the 'Rising Star' in the mortgage industry on their Dec 2022 Publication!

The **Mortgage Compliance Specialist** assists with researching and reviewing forms, loan disclosures, and other documents to validate information and ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations related to HMDA, Regulation B, TRID and RESPA.

Duties include:

* Manage a queue of Mortgage Loan Disclosures to review and disclose in a timely manner while coordinating with the Loan Officer as needed
* Loan Re-Disclosures: Manage the queue of re-disclosure needs from COC's while ensuring compliance and coordinating with Processing, Secondary, and the Loan Officer as needed
* HMDA reporting: Have knowledge of HMDA regulations while assisting with the quarterly and annual reports
* Compiling appropriate information for reporting purposes and providing direction to others to ensure compliance with regulations.
* Perform detailed compliance analysis on mortgage loans to ensure compliance including but not limited to Equal Credit Opportunity Act (ECOA), Fair Credit Reporting (FCRA), Home Mortgage Disclosure (HMDA), Homeowners Protection Act (HPA), Flood, Regulation O, Regulation P, Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act (RESPA), SAFE, Title 12, and Truth in Lending (TILA). Ensure that all loan files are documented per regulatory guidelines.
* Familiar with TX 50A6
* Review all compliance-related mortgage loan and consumer product forms and disclosures for regulatory adherence
* Pre-Funding and Post-Closing audits: Assist QC Managers with any pending disclosures needs with timely completion and responses.
* NMLS: Manage NMLS license and bond renewals for the company and Loan Officers
* Assist in researching compliance laws and regulations that affect the mortgage business

Salary: $50,000-$55,000/year

* **Minimum of 2 (TWO) years of mortgage compliance experience**
* **Preferred work experience with Texas Mortgage companies or has good knowledge of Texas mortgage guidelines**
* Must be knowledgeable and up to date in mortgage compliance guidelines and laws
* Ability to be detail-oriented, organized, punctual and reliable
* Ability to handle multiple tasks and complete tasks on set deadlines based on the company’s needs
* Strong verbal, interpersonal, and written communication skills
* Positive attitude and enthusiasm for the role
* Must be able to work independently
* Excellent computer skills (proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel)
* Knowledge of FHA. Conventional, and VA loan type
* Understanding of maintaining the confidentiality of non-public information

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to $26.44 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Application Question(s):

* Are you familiar with Texas mortgage compliance laws?

Experience:

* Mortgage Compliance: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Loan Assistant
description:
For the job function, the role of the Commercial Real Estate (CRE) Loan Assistant will utilize all of the firm’s tangible and in-tangible platforms including banking relationships, business knowledge, standardized expert template, niche acumen, and industry experience to:

* Foster and improve clientele, intermediary, banking, and/or broker relationships
* Assist management in the loan origination, documentation, processing and account maintenance
* Obtain and manage confidential data, files, and document collection on all borrowers, lenders, 3rd party vendors for firm projects.
* Conduct credit analysis to assess borrower's financial standing and loan eligibility

Requirements:

* Basic math principles and ability to perform calculations accurately
* Basic understanding of loan origination, contract processing, or related financial services field
* Ability to analyze credit reports and financial statements to assess borrower's creditworthiness
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively interact with clients and team members
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines

Site visitation, hotel conference, and employee recruiting will be required (20% potential travel time- all expense paid by Firm)

Please note that this job description is not exhaustive and additional duties may be assigned as needed.

* Flexible schedule

* Day shift
* Holidays
* Monday to Friday
* Night shift
* On call
* Overtime
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Loan processing: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Mortgage Branch Manager
description:
Semper Home Loans, a nationwide direct lender, is actively seeking self-generated licensed Regional Managers, Branch Managers, and Loan Officers. Whether you're a single individual who does a handful of loans a month or a Regional Branch Manager managing entire teams - we have the platform for you. Semper understands that this industry doesn't call for a one-size-fits-all model. We customize our platforms to cater your needs.  

  

**What's In It For You?**  

* Unmatched Pricing
* Unlimited Income Potential
* Ability to Manage Your Own P&L
* Designated Training and Processing Team
* 24 Hour Underwriting Turn-Times

* Smart Fees

title: Escrow Coordinator (REMOTE)
description:
This position is responsible for all or part of the following duties and responsibilities.  

  

Demonstrating strong decision making, analysis and communication skills examines the process lenders use to determine whether monthly escrow deposits will provide sufficient funds to pay taxes, insurance, and other bills when due. This position supports the Escrow Supervisor, and all others on the Data and Document Processes Management team.
Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Escrow Analysis (85%):* Analyze loan level files and policies and procedures on behalf of Allied and our clients. Review and analyze servicing reporting for escrow advances, lender placed insurance, and fee research. Accurately verify, key, and/or memo insurance information in relation to all escrow product/coverage types (windstorm, hazard, wind, etc). Update loan history based on research and documentation received (either written or verbal). Accurately compose written information for loan histories
* Gather, interpret, and use complex data to develop actionable steps that will improve processes and optimize results
* Assess company and client needs through receipt of information, research of loan history and analyzing data. Look for telltale trends or areas of improvement.
* Thoroughly understand Hazard forced placed certificates, procedures, and consequences of not following the correct processes and/or procedures. Maintain a knowledge of escrow servicing regulations to maintain compliance with Federal, State and agency specific guidelines
* Effectively and professionally present Escrow policies, procedures and tips as needed. Follows up and resolves problems or issues with little to no direction from supervisor or Document & Data Processes Management Team. Handles unique processes with little to no direction from supervisor or Document & Data Processes Management Team. Distribute and exchange information with others
* Conduct Web inquires to insurance companies to verify insurance and process the escrow work queue images with accuracy while meeting or exceeding department benchmarks
* Meet or exceed set goals and assigned workload expectations for productivity


Workload Support (15%):* Report any system related issues
* Assist supervisor with special projects
* Assist with mentoring of other employees in the Document & Data Processes Department as required
* Answers questions, corrects errors, and resolves discrepancies
* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk, working on a computer, and being available and responsive via email/phone/messaging
* Performs other duties as assigned


Qualifications (Education, Experience, Certifications & KSA):* High School Diploma required
* Associate’s degree, Vocational, or Technical School preferred
* 1-2 years of directly related work experience required

*The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with a job.*

title: Loan Closer
description:
Overview:

Lennar Mortgage is centered around personal growth, innovation, and diversity. We are looking for a new team member who shares our passion and dedication to bringing homeownership to life.  

At Lennar Mortgage, you’ll build your career with a Fortune 150 company that provides an excellent work environment, plenty of opportunities for advancement, and competitive benefits and compensation. Our success is a result of supporting and rewarding our team of elite professionals, who strive to exceed superior standards and exceptional services.  

#CB
#LI-CA1  


Responsibilities:

Primary function of a loan closer is to send closing instructions and closing document package to a closing agent within our required time frame. All information must be reviewed for accuracy and all supporting documentation must be included. The loan closer works closely with loan processors, production staff, and closing agent to ensure that closing dates are met. Review and approval of the Closing Disclosure (“CD”) and Settlement Statement (“ALTA”) is a critical function.* Review for accuracy all information in Loan Origination System required to close a loan.
* Wire necessary funds to the closing agent within the required time frame.
* Review and approve the final CD from the closing agent prior to authorizing the closing agent to fund the loan and release keys to the borrower.
* Become familiar with investors and State’s closing requirements, forms and procedures and comply.
* Check all loan documents for correctness and accuracy prior to funding.
* Coordinate closings with escrow coordinators, Branch Managers and Loan Officers.
* Interface with processors and borrowers as needed to collect conditions of approval.
* Anticipate loan-closing requirements and maintain the proper timeline to manage funding volume in order to meet funding goals.
* Monitor fees being charged, collected, and waived to ensure proper collection of fees and revenue.
* Follow up and obtain documents and/or corrections noted by Post Closing Department or investors.
* Assist Closing Supervisor as needed.
* Management reserves the right to change the duties and responsibilities set forth herein at any time.


Qualifications:
**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:*** High School Diploma or equivalent
* 3 - 5 years of closing and/or closing and processing Conventional/FHA/VA experience
* Strong computer background with 3 - 5 years experience in mortgage software
* Attention to detail
* Knowledge of office procedures
* Current knowledge of closing and title requirements
* Valid driver’s license

 **ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:*** Interact well with other associates
* Possess positive and professional attitude and represent company in a positive manner
* Provide outstanding customer service, work well under pressure and be a team player
* Possess excellent organization and analytical skills
* Possess excellent oral and written communication skills
* Strong computer skills
* Understand and follow posted work rules and procedures
* Accept constructive criticism
* This position outlines the basic tasks and requirements for the position noted. It is not a comprehensive listing of all job duties of the associate.

 **CONTACTS:**  

Regular interaction with Home Building Division, Mortgage Production Division, Processing staff and Closing Agents. **PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:**  

Requires the ability to operate a personal computer, fax machines, copier, bend, stoop, reach, lift, move, and carry materials and supplies weighing 20 pounds or less. Finger dexterity is required to operate a computer keyboard.  

Lennar is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. **Life at Lennar!**
Lennar recognizes our associates are the heart of the company’s success. Learn new skills, build your path, and become an integral part of the Lennar Family.
Lennar associates will be eligible for many benefits in accordance with Lennar’s policies and applicable plan terms, including:* Health Insurance - Medical, Dental & Vision
* Vacation – up to 3 weeks of vacation per year upon hire
* Holidays, Sick Leave, & Personal Days
* 401(k) Savings Plan with company match
* Paid Maternity & Bonding Leave
* New Hire Referral Bonus Program
* Home Purchase Discount for Associates
* Associate Assistance Plan
* Student Debt Repayment Plan
* Continuing Education Program
* Everyone’s Included Day
* This information is intended to be a general overview and may be modified by the Company due to factors affecting the business.


Type: Regular Full-Time

title: Manager, Loan Review
description:
**At Wipfli, people count**


The way you think makes you different. At Wipfli, we embrace that.


Our inclusive culture provides a space for everyone to have a voice. Our growing number of DEI resource groups celebrate diversity and champion awareness throughout Wipfli.


We’re also focused on helping you achieve success with balance. From hybrid schedules and flexible time off to training programs and mental wellness initiatives, we take care of our team.


If you want to be in an environment where you can grow, feed your curiosity and make a difference, Wipfli is the place for you.


Wipfli is seeking a Manager of Loan Review. This position will oversee financial institution client engagements, design and plan engagements, ensure completion of all work, meet with client management to ascertain client needs and service arrangements, and promote and identify opportunities for the firm

**Responsibilities:**

* Manage complex projects, ensuring accurate and timely completion.
* Responsible for analysis of the credit risks within individual commercial loans and commercial mortgages.
* Review loans to ensure that acceptable credit standards are maintained and that loans conform to established Client policy.
* Oversee the preparation of and produce workpapers and documentation in conformance with the firm’s quality control standards.
* Oversee the preparation of and produce written reports which clearly, appropriately, and accurately communicate engagement results.
* Train, mentor and provide direction to staff.
* Monitor and control budgets and productivity within areas of accountability.
* Maintain ongoing communication regarding client activities with the relationship partner, Director of Loan Review, engagement senior manager, associates on the engagements and/or performance coach.
* Develop new commercial Loan Review business.
* Prepare proposals and engagement agreements.
* Travel to client locations within the U. S. is required, 10% - 20%.
**Qualifications:**

* Business-related degree or a combination of education and related work experience.
* 10+ years of commercial loan review, commercial lending, and/or credit administration management experience with a consulting firm, regulatory agency, and/or financial institution.
* Working knowledge of commercial lending, agricultural lending, real estate development and construction lending, and the required collateral documents for each.
* Ability to effectively communicate to management any weaknesses in loan administration or other matters requiring attention.
* Exceptional client management skills.
* Strong analytical skills; experience with Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, and Access.
* Highly motivated and self-directed.
* Prior project management experience.
* Be comfortable leading engagements.


Wipfli is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All candidates will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identify, citizenship status, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics protected by federal, state, or local laws.


Wipfli is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete an application, interview, or participate in our recruiting process, please send us an email at hr@wipfli.com


Wipfli supports equal pay for equal work and values each candidate’s unique experiences and skill sets. The estimated pay range for this position is: $97,000 to $160,000. Compensation within the range is determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to, location, individuals' skills, experience, training, licensure and certifications, business needs and applicable employment laws.  

  

Individuals may be eligible for an annual discretionary bonus, subject to participation rules and based on a variety of factors including, but not limited to, individual and Firm performance.  

  

Wipfli cares about our associates and offers a variety of benefits to support their well-being. Highlights include 8 health plan options (both HMO & PPO plans), dental and vision coverage, opportunity to enroll in HSA with potential Firm contribution and an Employee Assistance Program. Other benefits include firm-sponsored basic life and short and long-term disability coverage, a 401(k) savings plan & profit share as well as Firm matching contribution, well-being incentive, education & certification assistance, flexible time off, family care leave, parental leave, family formation benefits, cell phone reimbursement, and travel rewards. Voluntary benefit offerings include critical illness & accident insurance, hospital indemnity insurance, legal, long-term care, pet insurance, ID theft protection, and supplemental life/AD&D. Eligibility for all benefits programs is dependent on annual hours expectation, position status/level and location. Wipfli offers flexibility for many positions to be performed remotely; please discuss your work preferences with your recruiter during the interview process.

**#LI-CL2 #LI-remote**

title: Loan Coordinator, VSBA Closing - Pasadena, CA
description:
**Who We Are:**  

VelocitySBA provides small business owners with access to growth capital through the SBA loan program. Having access to small business financing can give you the security and freedom to focus on other aspects of running your business. We can help you purchase commercial real estate and equipment, provide growth capital financing, deliver debt refinance solutions, aide with business acquisition/partner buyout, and assist small business owners with their startups.
  
  

**What’s in it for You:**  

VelocitySBA is one of the fastest growing SBA lending institutions in the country and is actively seeking motivated individuals interested in a career in business finance. Areas of opportunity include sales/business development, underwriting, closing, servicing, marketing and more as our organization very actively implements our national growth strategy. VelocitySBA offers distinctly a team culture that is more synergistic and collaborative than typical for financial institutions, creating a stimulating and enjoyable workplace environment. Candidates joining the VelocitySBA team can expect professional development and growth working alongside the best SBA professionals in the industry. Become a part of our team and immerse yourself in a company that fosters a Great Place to Work™ culture!
  
  

**What You’ll Do:**  

As a Loan Coordinator, you will serve as the main contact throughout the loan process, managing communication between clients, brokers, and the company. Your responsibilities include setting timelines, coordinating with various parties, collecting necessary documents, conducting due diligence searches, and engaging third-party reports to ensure a seamless closing process. Additionally, you will engage with preliminary title reports and ensure compliance with the Credit and Closing Checklist in the company's loan operating system.
  
  

**Job Duties:**  

* Facilitate the loan process as the primary point of contact from the initiation to closing and perform as a liaison between the customer and the Company.
* Set timelines to clients, brokers and other parties involved in the loan transaction to ensure a smooth closing process
* Correspond with clients, escrow/title and insurance companies to collect required items and coordinate closing
* Collect, review and upload all items listed on the Credit and Closing Checklist to Company’s loan operating system
* Engage preliminary title reports
* Conduct due diligence searches on borrower/guarantor/business. This includes, but not limited to ordering lien searches, credit reports, background checks and IRS tax transcripts
* Engage 3rd party reports such as appraisal reports, environmental assessment reports, business valuations, and site inspections.


**Skills and Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s Degree preferred
* Minimum 2 years of experience in SBA loan process
* Understanding and knowledge of SBA eligibility and guideline
* Good judgment and problem-solving skills
* Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
* Proficient in Microsoft Office, with the aptitude to learn new software and systems to onboard and process loans
* Team-oriented mindset
* Professional verbal and written communication skills


**Compensation:**  

* $60,000-$80,000/year depending on experience


Velocity Vehicle Group is an equal opportunity employer. Velocity Vehicle Group prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Mortgage CRM Marketing Support and Engagement Specialist
description:
Mortgage Division - CRM Marketing Support and Engagement Specialist
Magnolia Bank’s Mortgage Division is seeking a dynamic individual for the position of full-time CRM Marketing Support and Engagement Specialist. The successful candidate must have direct experience and expertise with Mortgage Industry based CRM and Marketing Platforms. This position is eligible for remote work.
Magnolia Bank is a community bank that has served the surrounding area for over 100 years. Our footprint includes banking centers located in Central Kentucky, mortgage offices throughout the U.S. and over 300 employees. We hold ourselves to the highest standard when it comes to providing an excellent customer experience through our personal way and the nurturing of our employees’ personal and professional growth. We keep a fun, friendly and engaging atmosphere all while living the Magnolia Values of Honesty, Integrity, Confidentiality, Excellence and Professionalism every day. Magnolia Bank is a customer focused bank that empowers, encourages, and engages our employees. Being Adaptive and Innovative is one of the main reasons Magnolia Bank continues to prosper.
We are currently seeking applicants for a CRM Marketing Support and Engagement Specialist.
Qualified Candidates responsibilities are:
* Assist with daily administrative tasks to ensure the functionality, coordination, and tracking of marketing activities conducted through Total Expert, Insellerate, and other CRM platforms.
* Act as a liaison between users and Total Expert, Insellerate, or other CRM platforms, gathering feedback and insights to improve user adoption and overall user experience.
* Collaborate with LPO Managers, Marketing, and Compliance to develop and design CRM based digital marketing campaigns for social media, email, mail, and mobile.
* Measure CRM marketing performance and analyze strategies to identify recommendations for improvements.
* Drive continuous improvement through research of CRM based marketing trends, industry best practices and relevant impacts.
* Serve as a subject matter expert on Total Expert, Insellerate and other CRM platforms, providing guidance and support to users.
* Stay updated on the latest features and functionalities of Total Expert, Insellerate, and other CRM platforms.
* Perform other related duties as needed or assigned, commensurate with level of responsibility and experience.
* Embrace and comply with the bank’s policies and procedures.
* Embrace and comply with the bank’s Purpose, Core Values and Mission


Candidates must also have knowledge in:
* Strong working knowledge of Total Expert, Insellerate, or similar mortgage-based customer relationship software.
* Knowledgeable about advertising and related lending compliance and regulatory requirements.
* Ability to work with limited supervision as well as within a collaborative team environment.
* Ability to work well under pressure to consistently meet stated deadlines.
* Communicate effectively with customers, stakeholders, and co-workers.
* Professionalism in conduct, communication, and appearance
* Strong people skills that demonstrate a positive attitude, outgoing and friendly personality
* Accuracy, attention to detail and organizational skills; time management skills


Enter Qualifications:
* College or professional courses related to marketing or advertising.
* College degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or minimum 4 years previous marketing experience is required.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications, Publisher, Encompass, and mortgage-based CRM products.
* Familiar with web content management and design
* Strong creative, writing, editing and proofreading skills.


Working Conditions:
* May require attendance to various promotional and community events outside regular work hour schedule.
* Occasional travel may be required.
* Hours: primarily Monday-Friday 8:00 am – 5:00 pm
* Possible Overtime, Weekends, or varying work hours to support teams in other time-zones.
* Eligible for remote work


This position reports to the Mortgage President.
If you want a place to work with opportunities to grow and a place that feels like home-come join us!

title: Transaction Coordinator
description:
**Coast to Close**   
Transaction Coordinator

Real Estate Transaction Management team seeking a full-time Transaction Coordinator holding a residential real estate license in both North Carolina and South Carolina. Minimum 2 years experience as a residential real estate agent or transaction coordinator required. Looking for an energetic and positive team player ready to jump into a full workload!

**Job Description:**   
A Real Estate Transaction Coordinator handles all activities from the point of contract through to closing. Our team services agents in North Carolina and South Carolina, real estate experience in either state is preferred. Desired candidate must be ethical, hard-working, honest, willing to learn and listen, and coachable.

**Responsibilities include:**

* Reviewing and processing all contract documents.
* Communicating with the realtors, clients, lenders, attorneys, inspectors, service providers, and all parties to a contract.
* Keeping all parties informed throughout the contract to close process.
* Coordinating and scheduling inspections, closings, and walkthroughs.
* Auditing contract documents for compliance and communicating with brokerage compliance departments.
* Maintaining all files related to the contract.
* Problem-solving in a fast-paced work environment.

**Qualities and skills:**

* SC and NC Real Estate License required (or having one license and willing to obtain second within 6 months)
* Detail-oriented with an ability to multi-task.
* Customer service-oriented.
* Ability to work in a demanding, fast-paced, and ever-changing profession.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including fluent English grammar, spelling, and punctuation.
* Reliability, diligence, ethics, dedication, and good performance are valuable traits for this position.
* Ability to problem solve.
* Keep track of and maintain closing deadlines.
* Goal-oriented with a strong focus on team spirit, positive attitude, and friendly workplace interaction.
* Willing to attend regular trainings.
* Excellent time management.
* Excellent computer and software skills with proficiency in the following:
* Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel)
* Adobe
* Gmail, Google Calendar, Google Drive, Google Forms
* Preferred experience with the following:
* Dot Loop
* TC Work Flow/ Open to Close
* KW Command
* Skyslope
* Pl@tform
* Zipforms
* ShowingTime/BrokerBay
* FlexMLS

**Goals:**   
To help the agents increase business by managing ALL contract tasks. To handle all administrative duties which include answering emails, keeping track of file systems, transactions, contract timelines, and most importantly customer service. To analyze production and set goals to improve team systems and overall success.

**FAQs**

* Must be able to provide their own laptop or desktop.
* Ability to work from home.
* Full-time. Ability to set your own hours and work schedule, but there will be 8 hours of work a day based on volume.
* Availability Monday through Friday 9am-5pm
* Flexible hours, whenever needed, to accommodate team priorities.
* Pay is per file/commission-based. Ability to increase based on performance.

**Note:**   
All applicants will have to complete a DISC personality assessment. This is NOT an entry-level position. Prior to final hiring, verification of work references will be necessary.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $30,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Experience level:

* 2 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* What does your timeline look like? When do you need to start?
* Do you live in North or South Carolina?

Experience:

* residential real estate: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* NC or SC Real Estate License (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: TPO Administrator (Pacific Time Zone)
description:

***MUST BE ABLE TO WORK UNTIL 6:00PM PACIFIC TIME.***


At UHM, we understand diversity comes in many different forms. It’s our commitment to improve inclusion in the workplace through programs and policies that establish a positive and inclusive environment where every Partner, regardless of their background, can grow and excel. We value **diversity**, educate on **equity**, and create **inclusive partner opportunities** to ensure that you know #U**Belong**AtUHM!

 **ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

* Enhance and execute standard onboarding routine for all new TPO partners
* Responsible for New TPO Partner Approvals, Renewals, and/or De-Activations
* Responsible for 3rd Party Processing Company Approvals, Renewals, and/or De-Activations
* Responsible for Warehouse provider's Approvals, Renewals, and/or De-Activations

**EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* 2 years of work experience in a professional environment
* Wholesale/TPO mortgage experience preferred

**SKILLS**

* Strong communication skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
* Experience managing multiple tasks and deadlines routinely
* Experience dealing directly with consumers and/or business partners
* Strong attention to detail and ability to multi-task

title: Escrow Operations Scheduler - Remote
description:
**Who We Are**
--------------


Join a team that puts its People First! First American's Direct division provides comprehensive title insurance protection and professional settlement services for real estate purchases, refinances and equity loans. Since 1889, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for eight consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than 50 regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com.

**What We Do**
--------------


Come join First American, where we recognize our true worth is our people. We are looking to add an Escrow Operations Scheduler - Remote to our growing team. In this role you will work in a dynamic, fast-paced setting supporting notary scheduling and overall order management. This role communicates with our users via the Snapdocs Scheduling platform and will function as a liaison between First American and our notary community. A top-notch Escrow Operations Scheduler will demonstrate excellent time management skills, is self-motivated and is passionate about providing positive experiences for our users.

**Some of your responsibilities will include:**

* Scheduling notaries for in-person signing appointments
* Managing the communication between title, notaries, and consumers to ensure each signing is completed successfully and updating order details per instructions provided by our users
* Performing outbound customer communications via phone as time sensitive issues arise
* Collaborating with our users to resolve common issues that occur during the duration of a scheduling order and escalating to a Lead when necessary
* Providing phone and email support for our users

**About you:**

* High school diploma required
* Requires a minimum of 1 - 2 years of customer service experience
* Strong written & verbal communication skills
* Ability to multitask, stay focused and self-manage in a fast-paced team environment where change is prevalent
* Detail oriented
* Ability to learn new computer system applications
* Empathetic & patient; can see things from others perspective, especially when problems arise
* Positive with a natural drive to help people, must be customer service oriented
* Curious and have a learning mindset, eager for feedback


Pay Range: $15.18 - $23.00 Hourly


This hiring range is a reasonable estimate of the base pay range for this position at the time of posting. Pay is based on a number of factors which may include job-related knowledge, skills, experience, business requirements and geographic location.

**What We Offer**
-----------------


By choice, we don’t simply accept individuality – we embrace it, we support it, and we thrive on it! Our People First Culture celebrates diversity, equity and inclusion not simply because it’s the right thing to do, but also because it’s the key to our success. We are proud to foster an authentic and inclusive workplace For All. You are free and encouraged to bring your entire, unique self to work. First American is an equal opportunity employer in every sense of the term.


Based on eligibility, First American offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, PTO/paid sick leave and other great benefits like an employee stock purchase plan.

title: Real Estate Transaction Coordinator
description:
NO LICENSE REQUIRED TO START

\\*\\*Best Place to Work Certified\\*\\*

Do you want a career with a growth path in Real Estate Investments, but don’t know where to start? Are you tired of working hard and not getting rewarded for your hard work? Join the company!

Fastest Home Offer is seeking a Transactions Coordinator who is a proven inside sales professional. Fastest Home Offer is a Real Estate Investment firm, specializing in the use of advanced technology, marketing and sales solutions to acquire and sell investment properties across the US. We operate in an entrepreneurial start up culture and thrive on challenging the status quo.

Our Team works in a non-corporate, fast paced sales environment. Our Team interacts with a variety of sellers in acquiring their property for our investors.

Below is a description written in the first person of the type of individual we are looking for –

I am an overachiever, Problem Solver, driven and want to succeed. Growing personally, building wealth and having fun in the process would be the ideal way for me to spend my days. I would like to build my career as a Real Estate investment professional.

Confidence in my abilities and my overachieving ways find me wanting to seek a position that offers unlimited earning potential and career growth. I love communicating with people and whether sales have been a part of my past or not, it fuels me. I recognize that I don’t know everything, and I am willing to humbly take the time to learn.

I want to be part of a company that will provide me with leads, administrative support and a sales system for success. My ideal career would be with a company that has a proven track record, is entrepreneurial in nature and takes pride in culture and fostering an environment to create, motivate and retain successful salespeople.

**WHAT WE OFFER YOU:**

* A determined GROWTH path towards learning the ins and outs of Real Estate Investments
* UNCAPPED earning potential and personal development
* We provide you with the tools you need in order to be SUCCESSFUL in Real Estate Investment (Technology, Marketing Leads, Resources)
* PROVEN sales system that allows you to reach your MAXIMUM earning potential
* Ongoing training on Real Estate investing and market trends
* Extra BONUS pay for top performers

**\\*BASE PAY PLUS BONUSES\\***

**Job Summary:**  
As a Real Estate Wholesale Transaction Coordinator, you will play a crucial role in managing and coordinating all aspects of our wholesale real estate transactions. You will be responsible for ensuring smooth communication between buyers, sellers, agents, and other stakeholders throughout the transaction process. Your exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail will be essential in facilitating successful deals and maintaining high levels of client satisfaction.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Coordinate and manage all aspects of real estate wholesale transactions from contract to closing.
* Serve as the main point of contact for buyers, sellers, agents, title companies, and other parties involved in the transaction.
* Review purchase agreements and ensure all necessary documentation is complete and accurate.
* Facilitate communication and resolve any issues or discrepancies that arise during the transaction process.
* Coordinate property inspections, appraisals, and other necessary services.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and company policies.
* Maintain organized transaction files and documentation for each deal.
* Provide regular updates to clients and stakeholders on the status of transactions.
* Assist with scheduling appointments, meetings, and property showings as needed.
* Collaborate with other team members to achieve company goals and objectives.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in real estate transaction coordination or a related field preferred.
* Strong understanding of the real estate transaction process and contract requirements.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and real estate transaction management software.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.
* Problem Solving Capabilities

**WHAT WE DON’T WANT:**

* Individuals that are looking for a standard 9-5
* Part-time candidates
* Individuals who are looking to practice traditional real estate (ie. Showing houses, doing open houses, etc.)
* Mediocre performers lack of self-motivation
* The need for micromanagement to perform
* Not open to feedback and constructive criticism

**Work Remotely**

* yes

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $35,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Experience level:

* 2 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Sales: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

description:
