title: Loan Analyst
description:
**Summary**


The Loan Analyst, Ops is responsible for preparing loan files for underwriting review. The Loan Analyst will be responsible for determining that all borrower documents and third-party documents meet agency and Freedom Mortgage guidelines.

**Essential Job Functions:**

* Review the appropriate credit, income, property, and asset documentation for VA and FHA cash out loans and conventional cash out and rate term loans
* Validate submitted information from the borrower is complete and accurate
* Validate that 3rd party documentation is complete and accurate including but not limited to: title, appraisal, insurance, credit supplements.
* Communicate accuracy of documents in O.S by updating appropriate fields.
* Enter detail comments in OS.
* Run PredProtect.
* Run DU or LP and be able to resolve errors
* Run and review FraudGuard.
* Scan applicable checklists into EDMS.
* Communicate with other departments additional needs to receive final approval from underwriting.
* Maintain regular and punctual attendance

**Other Related Duties:**

* Performs other related duties as assigned.

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**


This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

**Qualifications:**


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

**Education and/or Experience:**


4 year college degree preferred or 1 to 2 years previous experience in a mortgage environment . Must be able to work independently or as part of a team in a high-paced environment. Working knowledge of MS Office skills required.


**Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:**


None required

**Physical Demands**:


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

**Work Environment:**


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

**Equal Employment Opportunity**

Freedom Mortgage is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, ethnicity, color, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, religion, national origin, age (40 and over), disability, military status, genetic information or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

**Americans with Disabilities Act**

Applicants as well as employees who are or become disabled must be able to satisfactorily perform the essential job functions of the position either with or without reasonable accommodation. Applicants as well as employees are encouraged to meet with Human Resources as the organization shall review reasonable accommodations on a case-by-case basis in accordance with applicable law.

**Job Responsibilities**

The following statements reflect the general duties and responsibilities considered necessary to perform the essential functions of the job and should not be considered as an all-inclusive list of all the work requirements of the position. Freedom Mortgage Corporation may change the specific job duties with or without prior notice based on the needs of the organization.


  

Remote

title: Transaction Coordinator
description:
We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Real Estate Transaction Coordinator to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth and efficient completion of real estate transactions from contract to close. The Transaction Coordinator will collaborate with real estate agents, clients, lenders, and other vendors to facilitate a seamless process and deliver exceptional service.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Transaction Management:**
* Oversee the entire real estate transaction process, ensuring all necessary documentation is completed accurately and in a timely manner.
* Coordinate with real estate agents, clients, title companies, lenders, and other parties to ensure a smooth flow of communication and transaction progression.
* Monitor and track key dates, deadlines, and contingencies to prevent delays and facilitate a timely closing.
* **Document Preparation:**
* Prepare and review transaction documents, including contracts, addendums, and disclosures, to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and company standards.
* Assist in obtaining necessary signatures and approvals on documents and ensure the proper distribution of executed documents to all relevant parties.
* **Communication and Coordination:**
* Act as the primary point of contact for all parties involved in the transaction, providing regular updates and addressing any inquiries or concerns.
* Collaborate with real estate agents to gather necessary information and documentation, maintaining a proactive and responsive approach to communication.
* **Compliance and Regulations:**
* Stay informed about real estate laws, regulations, and industry practices to ensure transactions adhere to legal requirements.
* Assist in resolving any compliance issues or discrepancies that may arise during the transaction process.
* **Database Management:**
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date transaction records in the company database or transaction management system.
* Generate reports and summaries as needed for management and team members.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience as a Real Estate Transaction Coordinator or in a related role is preferred.
* An Active Georgia Real Estate License is preferred, but not required.
* Strong organizational and multitasking abilities with keen attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Familiarity with Georgia real estate contracts, forms, and transaction processes.
* Proficient in using real estate transaction management software and Microsoft Office Suite.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.

**Education:**  
A high school diploma or equivalent is required. Additional coursework or certification in real estate or related fields is a plus.

If you are a motivated individual with a passion for real estate and possess the skills to streamline transaction processes, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and contribute to the success of our real estate transactions!

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Expected hours: 10 – 40 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Choose your own hours
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: Remote

title: Experienced Closing Processor (Title)
description:
**Madison Settlement Services** is a dynamic and growing title insurance company. We are currently seeking a full-time, skilled and detail-oriented Experienced Closing Processor (**Title industry**). If you are customer service focused with strong organizational and analytical skills, we want to hear from you. We offer 100% paid employee medical, paid time off, 401(K) matching, vision and dental insurance. Position may be formatted for part-time role depending up the successful candidate.  

  

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


Open new orders, including taxes and separate searches  

Confirm vesting is consistent with general tab and confirm signers with client  

Request/Prepare Deeds, POAs, Trust Certs, Affidavits and handle pre-closing signings  

Obtain legal documents (ie. Trust, Divorce Decree) for vesting/signer issues and send to Title Examination Department for review  

Prepares commitments, CPLs, tax certs, etc and sends them to the client/lender  

Prepares title docs, including affidavits and additional documents prepared at closing  

Handles loan revisions and update requests  

Organized by either team based on client volumes and by task (ie subordinations, UCCs, NOCs, judgments)

  

Required Skills and Abilities:  

Excellent customer service skills- Must be polite, courteous and attentive to all customers, vendors and co-workers  

Effective and clear communication to co-workers, customers and outside vendors/clients  

Detail oriented  

Must be able to meet critical deadlines  

Ability to focus and multi-task  

Ability to resolve customer issues  

Ability to manage tasks independently  

Ability to learn quickly and adapt to change  

Strong organizational skills


Education: High School diploma or equivalent required


Experience: Previous title processing experience required (1-3 years)


Computer Skills: Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or similar software with the ability to learn new or updated software.


Certificates & Licenses: N/A

title: Junior Mortgage Loan Officer
description:
Our lending team is experiencing tremendous growth and we are looking for a results-oriented junior loan officer who can generate new business and referrals and assist our senior loan officers in creating and closing loan packages. Lending or mortgage industry experience is not required but is a tremendous asset. If you are tenacious, driven, and love a fast-paced career that allows your communication and interpersonal skills to truly shine, please start your application today!**Compensation:**
$100,000+ at plan

**Responsibilities:*** Liaise between realtors, senior MLO / mortgage loan originator, underwriter, mortgage lenders or mortgage bankers, and loan processors on behalf of the applicant as needed to assure the loan transaction is successful
* Discuss options with senior mortgage loan officer/ MLO to make a recommendation of which home loan products are best suited depending on applicant’s financial status
* Consult with potential loan applicants - answer questions and provide additional information about home loan products to create personal relationships
* Gather financial information to assist with loan applications, prepare loan files, and assess applicants’ financial situation and eligibility
* Meet sales expectations, generate new business, get referrals, and monitor sales pipeline

**Qualifications:*** Must be willing to complete training program to obtain NMLS/ MLO/ state license
* Understanding of loan programs guidelines and various types of loans such as FHA, commercial loans, VA, etc is helpful, but not required
* Superb relationship, sales, communication, and MS Office skills are needed
* Past experience with credit unions, lending institutions, real estate, financial services, or related fields is a bonus, but not required
* Some college (Bachelor’s) is preferred, but a high school diploma or equivalent is required


* NMLS license is required. If you currently do not have it, you must get one in VA, MD or DC (at one of these states) before getting onboard

**About Company**  

Motto Mortgage Choice is a wholesale mortgage brokerage located in Tysons Corner, VA. We have over 30 wholesale lenders in our network offering the very best service and rates to our clients. Motto Mortgage network has over 200 offices all over the country. *We are an equal-opportunity employer.*

title: VP of Business Development
description:
**Job Title: Vice President of Business Development** 

**Department: Analytics**

**Reports To: Chief Executive Officer** 

**Status: Full Time Hybrid**

**This position can be hybrid or remote with the exception of the following states: AK, CA, DC, FL, IL, MD, NV, NH, NY, OR and WA.**

Clean Energy Credit Union is passionate about promoting clean energy to protect our environment and improve our economy. *Our focus is on providing clean energy loans that reduce the cost of living for members while also decreasing their environmental footprint. We envision a world where everyone can participate in the clean energy movement.* 

**Primary Purpose of Position:**

The Vice President of Business Development will identify and communicate specific business development strategies across the Credit Union’s functional areas, applying experienced knowledge of Clean Energy CU, clean energy industry, business development, and business intelligence. Leads strategic analyses of business needs and environmental trends in support of business strategy development, dealer relations, and planning processes.

**Job Description**

Essential duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:

* Ensure accurate, relevant, and timely reporting to management and the Board of Directors. Continuously enhance analytical capabilities to provide strategic insights on key performance indicators.
* Track and assess banking and credit union news and trends to inform management’s strategies around the development of products and services.
* Ensure that membership and dealer growth and new product delivery align with established goals.
* Analyze and make appropriate recommendations for improving organization health, member/employee satisfaction, and effective organizational decision making.
* Oversee all dealer relations activities, including development of channel strategies, management of dealer relationships, constant improvement of dealer-facing processes.
* Expand the Credit Union’s competencies in business intelligence, including tools and other resources for assessing and communicating progress toward established key performance indicators.
* Analyze credit union metrics and optimize methods to continually improve organizational performance.
* Focus on the end-to-end member and dealer experiences to build and maintain relationships with those who do business with us.
* Facilitate development in organizational competency to build a deliberative process for innovation and continuous improvement in the member experience.
* Identify and lead re-engineering activities and initiatives that drive best-in-class member and dealer experiences.
* Look for and participate in networking activities with both a dealer/vendor focus and for the overall broader clean energy community to promote the credit union.
* Effectively control allocated budget dollars for department to assist with achieving the organization’s fiscal budget.
* Coordinate efforts with and make recommendations for any vendors that will assist with developing and maintaining the mission and goals of Clean Energy CU.
* Provide suggestions for improved efficiency and effectiveness in the credit union’s operations.
* Develop, implement, and monitor processes and controls to ensure the credit union exceeds industry benchmarks in quality and member experience.
* Excellent business development skills, including networking, cold-calling techniques, presentation skills, broad level credit union and clean energy product and service alliance capabilities, and communications.
* Creates partnership opportunities for new select employer groups as well as state, local and federal organizations.

**Position Titles That Report to this Position**

· Dealer Relations Manager

· Data Analyst

**Preferred Job Competencies**

· **Attention to Detail** – Ensuring that information collected, provided, and/or evaluated is consistent with all related information available; holding to regulatory standards, recognizing that they exist to protect and honor members’ financial well-being.

· **Detailed knowledge** of the credit union’s products, services, policies, and procedures.

· **Driving for Results -** *Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment; using measurement methods to monitor progress toward goals; tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals while deriving satisfaction from that achievement and continuous improvement.*

· **Data Analysis** – Gathering, manipulating, processing, and evaluating numeric data to guide credit union decisions.

· **Project Management** – ability to manage projects through to completion.

· **Earning Trust-** *Gaining others’ confidence by acting with integrity and following through on commitments while disclosing own positions; treating others and their ideas with respect and supporting them in the face of challenge.*

· **Service Excellence** - Taking actions and developing relationships necessary to meet and exceed member needs (includes relationships with members, coworkers, and external partners); holding self and others accountable for providing a positive member experience; using appropriate interpersonal skills to resolve difficult member situations and regain their confidence.

· **Communication** - Possessing and utilizing compelling written and verbal communication skills. Ability to speak to groups of all sizes in a professional manner. Ability to deliver presentations (in person and virtual) to educate and engage community groups and other networking events.

· **Process Development** – *Creating and improving procedures to increase workflow, efficiency, and outcomes.*

· **Driving Innovation** - *Creating an environment (culture) that inspires people to generate novel solutions with measurable value for existing and potential customers (internal or external); encouraging experimentation with new ways to solve work problems and seize opportunities that result in unique and differentiated solutions.*

**Education and Work Experience**

· Bachelor’s degree preferred, or progressive, relevant work experience.

· Minimum 10 years progressive experience in service and/or leadership roles, preferably with a financial institution and/or clean energy sales or service leadership position.

Working Environment/Physical Activities

This job operates in a professional office environment and may be eligible for remote work. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this job.

· Sedentary computer work.

· Position is subject to irregular hours.

· May require occasional travel to attend off-site meetings and or conferences.

· Must be able to lift 35 lbs.

· Ability to read, write, and understand English fluently.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $105,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you able to pass a background and credit check?

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Loan Processor
description:
Overview:

Lennar Mortgage is centered around personal growth, innovation, and diversity. We are looking for a new team member who shares our passion and dedication to bringing homeownership to life.  

At Lennar Mortgage, you’ll build your career with a Fortune 150 company that provides an excellent work environment, plenty of opportunities for advancement, and competitive benefits and compensation. Our success is a result of supporting and rewarding our team of elite professionals, who strive to exceed superior standards and exceptional services.
Responsibilities:

Competently perform duties associated with Conventional, FHA and VA loan processing. Duties to include communicating with, and gathering documentation from, customers and reviewing income, credit, assets appraisal, and title work for accuracy and completeness. Requires consistent communication with customers, Lennar associates and other departments. #* Process and close loan applications from initial set-up through funding
* Obtain loan income, asset & credit approvals within 30 days of purchase agreement date
* Ensure all conditions and requirements of underwriting and investors have been met
* Request, review, and analyze collected documents from borrowers and compare to underwriting requirements in order to fulfill conditions
* Maintain a pipeline of loans with an emphasis on customer service, quality, accuracy and efficiency
* Learn and maintain knowledge of different loan programs
* Maintain status and information within processing software system
* Obtain the purchase agreements, escrow instructions, and final sales price confirmation to order the appraisal for all purchases
* Keep current with investor and internal guideline changes
* Maintain continued, effective communication with borrowers, escrow/title, sales agents and Loan Officers
* Maintain communication with the borrowers with reference to “needs items” and/or approval conditions to meet the Regulation B notification requirement
* Ensure loan is prepared for closing by having all title work and HOI in file and reviewed
* Proficiency in handing confidential information and documents


Qualifications:
* At least 5 years' experience as a Mortgage Loan Processor
* Current knowledge of closing and title requirements
* Current knowledge of loan processing and automated underwriting
* Encompass experience is preferred
* Excellent customer service skills
* Proficient with Microsoft Suite

**Life at Lennar!**
Lennar recognizes our associates are the heart of the company’s success. Learn new skills, build your path, and become an integral part of the Lennar Family.
Lennar associates will be eligible for many benefits in accordance with Lennar’s policies and applicable plan terms, including:* Health Insurance - Medical, Dental & Vision
* Vacation – up to 3 weeks of vacation per year upon hire
* Holidays, Sick Leave, & Personal Days
* Everyone’s Included Day
* 401(k) Savings Plan with company match
* Paid Maternity & Bonding Leave
* New Hire Referral Bonus Program
* Home Purchase Discount for Associates
* Associate Assistance Plan
* Student Debt Repayment Program
* Continuing Education Assistance
* This information is intended to be a general overview and may be modified by the Company due to factors affecting the business.

  

\\*You can use your Everyone's Included Day to celebrate, observe, and engage in an event or activity that is of personal significance to you, such as cultural, religious, or social causes or activities.\\*  

Lennar is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws.  


Type: Regular Full-Time

title: Processor Assistant
description:
The Processor Assistant position plays an integral role in the mortgage origination loan process within ALCOVA Mortgage. This position is responsible for reviewing and validating all information presented by the Loan Officer for the set up of new files. The Processor Assistant works closely with other Processor Assistants and Processors to ensure loan applications are thoroughly completed and adhere to Company, client, and industry-established standards. The Processor Assistant must have excellent 'people skills' and be driven with the desire to ensure every application is handled with excellent care and attention.

 **Responsibilities:**
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.

* Review new Loan Applications through Encompass to determine if all information given by Loan Officers/Assistants are correct, including but not limited to; supporting documents, contracts, and all package disclosures
* Orders all third-party reports including, but not limited to: Tax Transcripts, Preliminary Title Reports, Payoffs, Employment Verifications, Homeowner’s information (HOI), and Appraisals
* Utilizes the Encompass Task List to Support Loan Processors in all areas needed/requested
* Maintains mortgage loan information confidentiality
* Communicate to the Team Lead if unable to achieve a timeline or resolve an error
* Escalates any suspected fraudulent files to the Compliance Team

**Qualifications:*** A high school diploma or equivalent education is required
* Ability to adapt to changing environments, situations, and job responsibilities
* Ability to prioritize complex diversified responsibilities and multi-task in a fast-paced environment
* Must be willing to assist teammates and build strong relationships with Loan Officers and Operations team members to achieve closing goals
* Self-starting, self-reliant, highly motivated, ambitious, dependable, and driven to succeed
* Technologically savvy and comfortable learning new computer systems and programs
* Ability to operate under immense pressure and manage stress well
* Knowledge of Encompass software is strongly preferred
* Must be trustworthy, honest, and able to continuously display a high level of integrity
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy
* Able to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner
* Able to understand and respond appropriately to basic inquiries
* Able to read, write, and communicate using the English language sufficient to perform job functions
* Ability to use Company equipment in assigned areas (including but not limited to telephone, copiers, fax machines, computers, internet, etc.)
* Able to access, input, retrieve, and interpret information using applicable computer systems (including, but not limited to, Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, industry-specific computer software, etc.)
* Well-versed with keyboard shortcuts and able to identify new ways to complete a task in less time
* Relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals
* Works well under general supervision
* Able to handle deadlines and work within banking guidelines
* Compliance with all Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), Anti-Money Laundering (AML) laws, and Office of Foreign Asset Controls (OFAC) requirements is required. Employees must complete annual training in these areas

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**

* This job operates in a clerical office setting with climate-controlled surroundings, adequate lighting, and little or moderate noise when in the office. These standards must be met if working remotely. In this role, the individual routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

* This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing and photocopying are required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets, and bend or stand as necessary.

**EXPECTED HOURS OF WORK**

* Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.Evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.

**OTHER DUTIES**

* This position performs additional duties as assigned, given adequate guidance and resources. This Job Description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee to perform this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.


EOE D/V/M/F

**About Company**  

Most companies start with a business plan. ALCOVA Mortgage started with a friendship. Bound by a common background and inspired by a passion to serve, childhood friends Bobby Nicely, Billy Siple and Rob Lindstrom dreamed of one day starting a business.


In 2003, the trio joined together to establish a mortgage company—ALCOVA—an acronym for Alleghany County, VA, in honor of their roots.


In 2012, ALCOVA Mortgage made its debut on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest-growing private companies in the United States and has been recognized every year since. The company’s phenomenal growth of 96% in three years propelled it into the league of such legendary superstars that gained notoriety on the prestigious list as Dell, Microsoft, LinkedIn, Pandora, Timberland, Zillow, Yelp, and Domino’s Pizza.


Today, ALCOVA continues to thrive, largely because of its roots in friendship and the passion to serve.

  

EOE/M/F/D/V

title: Digital Lending Specialist
description:
**ABOUT THE COMPANY:**



Nymbus (https://nymbus.com/) isn't just a leader in fintech; we're a community of innovators passionate about reimagining banking. Our award-winning modern core platform and cloud-based technology serve as the backbone for financial institutions eager to modernize and excel.



Here, you won't just be part of a tech revolution; you'll be at the helm, driving change. You'll fit right in if you're a creative thinker eager to lessen technical debt and elevate agility for banks and credit unions. Our culture thrives on collaboration, integrity, and a client-first approach.



Your journey with us won't simply advance your career; it will offer the chance to shape an industry alongside like-minded professionals. We're excited to consider you a key player in this transformative chapter. Thank you for contemplating a role with Nymbus.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**



We are a remote first company with the exception of a few positions being onsite in our designated locations. The positions which are remote you will need to be able to travel a few times a year. You may be required at times to visit client sites or attend meetings at designated locations with your team members.


**POSITION SUMMARY:**



Under the supervision of the Digital Operations Manager, the Digital Lending Specialist will perform a variety of loan processing and operational functions in connection with Commercial and Consumer loans. This includes managing and coordinating the loan processing functions and any operational activities related to the commercial and consumer loan lifecycle.

  


**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES****:**

  


**Loan Approval and Documentation:**


* Ensure accurate and proper approval, documentation, closing, funding, and booking of loans.
* Adhere to applicable credit approvals, loan policies, state and federal regulations, and legal standards.


**Loan Processing and Support:**


* Provide quality service and effective loan processing support for digital lending clients.
* Assist in gathering, preparing, and maintaining loan documentation for new and existing loans.


**Knowledge Management:**


* Establish and maintain organized files and records for loan documentation.
* Build and maintain lending procedures, checklists, and workflows to ensure compliance and meet service level agreements (SLAs).


**Quality Assurance:**


* Maintain high levels of service, quality, and compliance in all business lending workflow processes.
* Complete loan checklists, personal loan audits, and participate in quality assurance (QA) and audit requests.


**Reporting and Compliance:**


* Ensure appropriate documentation is received and completed at the time of application and/or origination.


**Post-Closing Duties:**


* Perform various post-closing duties, including following up on final title policies and deeds, paying fees, and conducting quality control.


**Process Improvement:**


* Participate in the review and recommendation of automation and/or robotic systems to enhance scalability and eliminate manual processes.


**Issue Resolution and Support:**


* Support audit requests, regulatory updates, compliance requests, and resolve loan operational issues in a timely manner.


**Client Relationship:**


* Demonstrate a thorough understanding of client lending policies, procedures, and philosophies.
* Apply loan expertise to create or refine a best-in-class program for digital clients, ensuring world-class experiences for end-users.


**Problem Solving:**


* Identify and investigate problems independently, asking pertinent questions to drive shared understanding.


**Additional Responsibilities:**


* Perform other duties as assigned by DXC Leadership.
  


**PREFERRED EXPERIENCE****:**

  


* Experience analyzing financial data related to loan requests
* Experience Performing risk assessments on potential loan recipients based on credit rating, borrowing history, and other specific risk factors
* Applied knowledge of underwriting fundamentals and standard industry practices

  


**QUALIFICATIONS****:**

  

* 1-2 years experience in a lending support role (i.e., unsecured, commercial, mortgage, SBA, special assets, etc.)
* Experience in multiple products and/or multiple phases of the commercial and/or consumer loan lifecycle is preferred
* Current on trends in Fintech and Lending; familiarity with the digital banking ecosystem is a plus
* Highly passionate and positive in a rapidly changing and fast-paced environment
* Ability to work under pressure and in an organized manner delivering consistent results
* Experience with solving problems through technology and ability to make decisions
* Excellent communication skills and outstanding active listening abilities
* Experience using tools and loan origination platforms, and credit analysis software
* Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects and deadlines simultaneously


Salary & Benefits:


* $50,000 - $60,000 Annual Salary
* Annual Cash Bonus and Equity Options commensurate with the role level and experience
* 100% Fully Remote
* Robust 401(k) plan with company match
* Insurance - Health, Dental and Vision (Nymbus covers 100% of the Healthcare and Basic Dental premiums)
* Flexible Paid Time Off

  

Ready to join? We invite you to watch this video and learn who we are and how we build and innovates together!



Let's Go!

title: Payroll Processor I
description:
**Summary:**

The Processor, Payroll I position is responsible for gathering, computing, auditing and disbursing, wages, deductions, taxes and other withholding's. Balancing payroll time records/ interfaces, making changes to time records and entry to other payroll related data in accordance with company policy and procedures. Provides customer support through Service Now (SNow), email, or in writing (fax or mail). Relies on documented instructions and pre-established guidelines to perform the job functions and works under immediate supervision. Prepares and routes reports and or/payments to management, government agencies, insurance companies, vendors, and others. Handles all and any other duties assigned by Payroll Management.

**Essential Job Functions:**

* Handles time record follow-up and ensures follow company policies.
* Gather, review, and enter payroll changes from management, HR, and/or affiliates.
* Ensure timely & accurate review/processing of employee changes.
* Balances payroll earnings and deductions and processes related payments.
* Provide customers support to employees, HR and other interested parties through SNow, email, and in writing (fax or mail).
* Assists with system testing in Sandbox under the direction of Payroll Specialist II, III or Payroll management.
* Complete various payroll processes such as manual payments, garnishments, ACH activities, wires, etc.
* Current on changes to payroll and garnishments procedures and guidelines.
* Ensure work is done in accordance with the guidelines set forth for the department and SOPs are followed and updated with the most current practice and provided to management for signoff and posting.
* Assist management with special projects and payroll activities such as year-end as needed.
* Inform management of potential or significant problems and personnel-related issues.
* Maintain regular and punctual attendance.

**Other Related Duties:**

Performs other related duties as assigned.

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**


This position is an individual contributor. Does not have any supervisory responsibilities.

**Qualifications:**


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

* Basic knowledge of commonly used payroll concepts, practices, and procedures.
* Solid knowledge and understanding of mortgage loan documents and related required documentation.
* Strong customer service skills and the ability to support customers via SNow and on the phone.
* Ability to identify and handle confidential information in an appropriate manner.
* Ability to multi-task, work under pressure in a fast-paced, team environment.
* Intermediate organizational skills with a solid level of written and interpersonal communication skills to communicate effectively.
* Detail oriented with basic analytical & problem-solving skills.
* Must be able to follow and apply verbal/written procedures and guidelines.

**Education and/or Experience:**

* Two-year Accounting degree or equivalent experience, preferred.
* One (1) to three (3) years of payroll experience.
* Experience with computers and software applications, including word processing, spreadsheets, email, and internet websites.
* Experience working in a remote environment and actively participates in team or individual meetings.
* Experience with Workday software, preferred.

**Licensing/Certification/Registration**:


None required.

**Physical Demands:**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

**Work Environment:**


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Work is normally performed in a typical interior office work environment which does not subject the employee to any hazardous or unpleasant elements. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

**Equal Employment Opportunity:**


Freedom Mortgage is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, ethnicity, color, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, religion, national origin, age (40 and over), disability, military status, genetic information or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

**Americans with Disabilities Act:**


Applicants as well as employees who are or become disabled must be able to satisfactorily perform the essential job functions of the position either with or without reasonable accommodation. Applicants as well as employees are encouraged to meet with Human Resources as the organization shall review reasonable accommodations on a case-by-case basis in accordance with applicable law.

**Job Responsibilities:**


The statements reflect the general duties and responsibilities considered necessary to perform the essential functions of the job and should not be considered as an all-inclusive list of all the work requirements of the position. Freedom Mortgage Corporation may change the specific job duties with or without prior notice based on the needs of the organization**.**


  

Remote

title: Business Development Consultant - Credit / Lending Industry (Remote)
description:
Pearl's mission is to make our global community a better place by giving homeowners the tools to improve their homes' health, comfort, efficiency, resilience — and value. We are passionate about improving the performance of residential buildings as a way to improve people's lives and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.


Pearl Certification is a dynamic Public Benefit Corporation that renders high-performance energy-efficient home value visible through its comprehensive certification system. Pearl's certification drives demand for efficient home improvements by capturing their value for resale and appraisal, benefiting homeowners and the contractors, builders, raters, real estate professionals, and public entities who serve them. Pearl's products are de-risked, in-market, and scaling ahead of nationwide adoption that will be accelerated by the rollout of the Inflation Reduction Act, which directs nearly $400 billion in federal funding to clean energy.


We believe Pearl has a tremendous latent opportunity to change the lending and securitization equation by developing a direct strategy and product offering for the lending community. **We are looking for a seasoned finance professional who is excited to help us explore this opportunity as a consultant and then (ideally) join full-time to design, build, and run this new line of business for Pearl.**


Our ideal candidate will have **extensive experience in asset-based finance, lending, or securitization**, including but not limited to **energy transition, real estate, or infrastructure**. **The candidate will be well-versed in both Pearl's core certification business and the inner workings of lending and securitization to lead targeted, ongoing financial product development and help us vet this line of business.**


**As the Credit Opportunity Business Development Consultant, you will:**


* Conduct market research and product development ideation to identify viable business opportunities for Pearl within the lending industry
	+ Using industry knowledge and connections, develop approaches, solutions, and recommendations that effectively and efficiently address the most impactful opportunities and challenges related to partnering with loan originators, servicers, and packagers
	+ Articulate the value created by potential Pearl product and service offerings and the amount of that value Pearl can capture
* Meet with Board, executive team, and appropriate staff to understand Pearl's diverse business activities and actively engage in strategic planning discussions
* Produce and explain key insights and findings in a comprehensive and detailed manner
* Provide advice or suggestions based on market feedback and make adjustments to business development strategy as needed
* Formulate plans to implement recommendations and overcome objections from potential partners


**What we're looking for in a Credit Opportunity Business Development Consultant:**


* Experience in asset-based finance, lending, or securitization, including but not limited to energy transition, real estate, or infrastructure
* Product management experience
* Deeply conversant in loan packaging, lending operations, and underwriting
* Enthusiasm and passion for Pearl's mission
* Ability to quickly learn and understand Pearl's products, services, and value propositions
* Strong relationship building skills - can engage and influence decision-makers in the financial industry
* A confident networker, communicator, and listener who can talk the wall street talk while enthusiastically promoting Pearl's mission
* A strategic thinker with an entrepreneurial spirit
* Experience and comfort working with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders
* Authorization to legally work in the U.S.


**For a candidate to successfully transition from consulting to full-time leadership role, you will also:**


* Possess strong leadership skills - we anticipate this line of business becoming its own division with the leader assuming P&L and people management responsibilities
* Have a commitment to candor, integrity, and accountability
* Be a flexible, reliable, and collaborative team player
* Please note that Pearl requires full-time employees to be fully vaccinated (and boosted if the appropriate time period has passed) for business travel and in-person meetings


**Nice to Have:**


* Knowledge of the following industries: home contracting, solar, energy efficiency, residential, new construction, real estate
* Sell-side and buy-side experience (preferably in principal investing)


**Why work at Pearl?**


* We are a dynamic and growing startup where your opinion and contributions will make a big difference to our future
* We are a mission-driven company: we love what we do and the impact we are making
* Our company culture is supportive, team-based, and fun
* We are 100% remote - work where you feel comfortable
* We take our corporate values seriously, incorporating them into staff development checkpoints, hiring practices, and team building activities
* Pearl is an equal opportunity employer, and candidates from all backgrounds and life experiences are encouraged to apply


**Compensation:**


* Market rates will be based on experience and local conditions, in the anticipated range of $125 to $175 per hour. However, we are open to candidates guiding the conversation surrounding consulting rates. We want to ensure we are able to capture the most suitable candidate to lead this potentially business changing strategic opportunity for Pearl.

title: Mortgage Loan Officer
description:
We’re hiring a loan officer (purchased-based loan officers only who have their own self-sourced business - NO CONSUMER DIRECT LO's) who will work directly alongside our loan origination staff to help our applicants through the mortgage loan process. You’ll get applicants mortgage-ready, prepare paperwork, and respond to customer inquiries on transactions as needed. If you’re a detail-oriented employee with strong communication and time management skills, we highly encourage you to apply.

**Compensation:**
$300,000 yearly

**Responsibilities:*** Coordinate and prepare documentation necessary for verifications and underwriting such as loan files, loan packages, credit reports, and additional mortgage application paperwork
* Act as the primary contact between our clients and our company and schedule and conduct meetings to discuss any follow-up issues or items that need to be addressed
* Check all loan package documents for complete accuracy and submit any discrepancies to the loan officer/ loan originator
* Assist with administrative duties such as making and screening calls, booking appointments, etc.
* Follow up and respond to customer and in-house inquiries on transactions as needed in order to provide superior customer service


* Work with your own self-sourced referral sources/agents/past clients, etc. on a daily basis to continue ***close 2 units per month minimum*** in purchase volume or more
* You will be provided an LOA, an expense account, and a dedicated processor for production of $1M or more per month

**Qualifications:*** Strong understanding of loan financing options such as conventional loans, FHA, VA, adjustable/ fixed, commercial loans, etc.
* High school diploma or equivalent required. College degree in finance or banking preferred
* Preferably 5+ years of experience in a professional office or mortgage environment as a mortgage loan officer assistant or similar position
* Highly motivated and goal-oriented with excellent customer service and communication skills
* Having an NMLS license is not required, but is preferred


* Must be a purchased-based producer with your own self-sourced business
* Must currently close 2 purchase units a month or more in self-sourced purchase business

**About Company**  

* We are a bank so you are exempt from Licensing in 49 States
* We offer all standard products: Conv, FHA, VA, USDA, and Jumbo along with Niche products such as Bank Statements, 100% Doctor Loans, 3/2/1 Buy Downs, 1X Close CP Loans, 100% DPAs, TBD underwriting, much much more...
* State-of-the-art Marketing
* Fast turn times in a paperless environment
* Ability to broker out loans if needed

title: SBA Closer
description:
**Summary:** The SBA Closer is responsible for preparing SBA forms, submission to the SBA, and ensuring compliance and adherence to SBA SOP and First Bank of the Lake policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements. Knowledge of commercial lending and SBA lending processes is required to assist in preparing this information.


**The ideal candidate must have extensive Government Guaranteed Lending experience.**

  

**Job Requirements:**

  

* Minimum of 3 years’ experience in Small Business Administration industry with a focus on packaging and closing loans
* Knowledge of commercial lending documentation and/or operations in banking, law firm, title company or other related industry
* Detailed knowledge of the SBA SOP is required.
* Fundamental knowledge of business financial statements and credit factors relating to commercial loans
* Skilled with Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and related software applications (LaserPro, nCino, Fiserv, and Portal is a plus)
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Well organized, ability to multi-task and attention to detail
* Ability to prioritize, work well under pressure and meet deadlines.
* Must be able to work in a team environment and adapt to change.
* Must complete all required training, including Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-money Laundering training, suitable to his or her position within the bank.

**Job Functions:**


* Manage 4-6 SBA active loans in closing stage with an average of 2 closings per month based upon product and complexity.
* Prepare and submit Non-Delegated ‘GP’ and Preferred Lending ‘PLP’ loan requests via ETRAN.
* Generate Closing Checklist and coordinate initial call with the borrower, BDO and attorneys.
* Work closely with the borrower, BDO and attorney to ensure a smooth closing process.
* Responsible for timely communication with Borrower of missing items needed to complete loan closing.
* Maintains control over loans in process to detect any potential and/or developing problems and ensure all department managers are informed of the issues
* Order flood certifications, tax transcripts, UCC/Federal/State/County preliminary lien searches, title commitments and request from borrower the essential loan documentation as indicated by Underwriter, First Bank of the Lake, SBA procedures to ensure completeness of loan files.
* Reconcile equity injection and make final verification determination.
* Knowledge of AIA contracts, permits, builder’s risk and other construction documents so that you may coordinate a smooth handoff to the SBA Construction Coordinator
* Build electronic loan folder and scans loan documents into FBOL system of record.
* Follow internal audit procedures to ensure files are properly documented.
* Must complete all required training, including Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-money Laundering training, suitable to their position within the bank.
Other projects as assigned by management.  
* 

**Physical Requirements:**

Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.


Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds at times.


Travel as required for in-person meetings and / or training.  



**EEO Statement**


We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status or any other protected category.  



All offers of employment shall be subject to successful completion of all pre-employment screenings, verifications, and processes. Failure to comply with these processes, or failure to successfully pass all phases of the pre-employment screening will result in a withdrawal of employment offer.  



**Other Duties**


Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

title: Loan Processing Associate
description:
### **About Morty**



Morty is on a mission to revolutionize the outdated mortgage industry by letting people shop, compare, and close any mortgage option from any lender, completely online. Purchasing a home is the largest, most important financial transaction of most people's lives. We believe getting a mortgage should be just as simple, modern, and transparent as buying anything else online. We're building the first-ever, fully digital marketplace to make this possible.



Morty was founded by a diverse team of mortgage industry vets and software engineers and is supported by an incredible group of investors and advisors including Thrive Capital, Lerer Hippeau, Prudence, and Techstars who have backed companies like Oscar, Compass, Lemonade, Slack, Airbnb, Stripe, Dropbox, Casper, and Warby Parker.


### **Who We're Looking For**



We are seeking a detail-oriented, resourceful, and proactive individual to join our Loan Production team. You will be responsible for processing a high volume of straightforward tasks that are essential to making the mortgage process run smoothly. Meanwhile, you will have the opportunity to develop your mortgage underwriting skills and / or lead process improvements, depending on your interests. You have a great work ethic and are always willing to pitch in to help the team.


### **Job Responsibilities**


* Manage workflows in our lender portals, including locking and disclosing files.
* Manage homeowner's insurance, title, and appraisal workflows.
* Review client documents and determine if files are ready for submission. Proactively flag and resolve any potential problems.
* Identify operational bottlenecks and pain points, and collaborate cross-functionally to develop and implement short and long-term solutions.

### **Job Qualifications**


* Minimum two years of experience in the mortgage industry.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage deadlines without micromanagement.
* Willing and able to learn quickly. Self starter with a "No task is too big or small" attitude.
* Results-driven and persistent. Ability to stay calm and level-headed in stressful or frustrating circumstances.
* Excited to join a startup and put in the hustle required to get things done!


**Salary Range:** $40,000 - $50,000, depending on candidate experience and location

title: Closing Associate
description:
### **About Morty**



Morty is on a mission to revolutionize the outdated mortgage industry by letting people shop, compare, and close any mortgage option from any lender, completely online. Purchasing a home is the largest, most important financial transaction of most people's lives. We believe getting a mortgage should be just as simple, modern, and transparent as buying anything else online. We're building the first-ever, fully digital marketplace to make this possible.



Morty was founded by a diverse team of mortgage industry vets and software engineers and is supported by an incredible group of investors and advisors including Thrive Capital, Lerer Hippeau, Prudence, and Techstars who have backed companies like Oscar, Compass, Lemonade, Slack, Airbnb, Stripe, Dropbox, Casper, and Warby Parker.


### **Who We're Looking For**



We are seeking a detail-oriented, resourceful, and proactive individual to join our Loan Production team. You will own a pipeline of submitted loans and will collaborate with loan officers, our lender partners, and other third parties to facilitate smooth closings. Excellent customer service is your baseline and you are genuinely excited to help folks close their home financing! You have a great work ethic and are always willing to pitch in to help the team.


### **Job Responsibilities**


* Manage a pipeline of active loans from submission to close, working with lenders and third parties to ensure deals close seamlessly and on-time.
* Facilitate a transparent experience for loan officers and borrowers, with clear communication on late stage underwriting requests and the closing process.
* Ensure the receipt and review of all final conditions for a timely closing.
* Identify operational bottlenecks and pain points, and collaborate cross-functionally to develop and implement short and long-term solutions.

### **Job Qualifications**


* Minimum two years of experience in a role focused on closing mortgages.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage deadlines without micromanagement.
* Willing and able to learn quickly. Self starter with a "No task is too big or small" attitude.
* Results-driven and persistent. Ability to stay calm and level-headed in stressful or frustrating circumstances.
* Excited to join a startup and put in the hustle required to get things done!


**Salary Range:** $40,000 - $50,000, depending on candidate experience and location

title: Title Agent
description:
**About Us:**

Inked Land Company provides land acquisition and land development services to the energy sector. We are technology driven and highly focused on the success of our people, our clients, and our industry. Our clients range from startups to some of the largest publicly traded energy companies across the energy spectrum. Whether they are investing in infrastructure, resource extraction or power generation, we provide custom, repeatable, and scalable land acquisition and development processes to execute their vision. We are growing and we are looking for passionate, hardworking, and talented people to join our team. Come join us as we develop exciting clean energy projects across the United States!

**About the Position**

Inked Land Company is seeking a Full Time Contract Title Agent. The Title Agent will report to and work directly with a Sr. Title Agent and/or Title Manager in a remote capacity, while utilizing Company Software and Microsoft Office/Teams. This position is remote with 25-50% travel possible. Travel will mostly consist of abstracting index books at courthouses, gathering probates, and imaging, if necessary. When working remote, the Title Agent will organize and analyze instruments gathered in the Courthouse, create a complete chain of title, generate Title Reports, and communicate with their manager on progress, needs, and title issues. The Title Agent will work both independently and on teams. Title projects can range from 1 week to several months and across multiple States and Counties. The Title Agent should be driven and know when to communicate with management when necessary. Autonomy and promotions are available, at management’s discretion, for agents that show consistent growth in title knowledge and excellent work product. We are looking for a self-starter that thrives in a fast paced work environment and wants to further their career in Energy while being part of our growing team.

Responsibilities

* Research county records to determine surface and mineral ownership by utilizing online databases or travelling to the local county courthouse to review index books and instruments
* Analyze relevant instruments to determine if they are applicable to the title chain/report
* Meet deadlines and balance multiple priorities in an environment with shifting timeframes
* Contribute to other duties assigned by management and determined by business needs
* Must be able to work alone, make decisions and use judgment while researching county records and performing other related activities.
* Ability to travel 25-50% as dictated by job requirements

Mandatory Requirements

* Minimum of 1-3 years of experience as a title agent or a related title position, with an emphasis on mineral title experience
* Must possess competent knowledge and skills in land description and terminology, surface and sub-surface rights, document analysis, and explanation of defects for title reports
* Proficient in Microsoft Office, predominantly Excel and Word
* Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication, problem-solving, time management, and computer skills
* Ability to meet specific deadlines, daily and weekly, based on current internal and client needs
* Ability to work with minimal supervision, to work alone, make decisions and use judgment while researching county records and performing other related activities
* Ability to communicate professionally with all levels of management and clients (in writing and verbally)

Preferred Qualifications

* Bachelor’s degree
* Degree in Energy Management/Commerce
* AAPL membership

Inked Land Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to building and sustaining a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace that respects and values distinct cultures, experiences, perspectives, and unique identities. Inked Land Company strives to create a work environment that fosters our core values of respect and integrity in our workplace and the communities where we work.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $300.00 - $350.00 per day

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Title Abstracting: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Virtual Financial Services Representative
description:
* Work From Anywhere with the US!
* Part-Time!
* Very Flexible Schedule!
* 100% COMMISSION BASED
* Amazing opportunity to earn national and state licenses, engage with people from all backgrounds, and educate them on the fundamentals of a firm financial foundation.
* The industry is looking for mature, self-starting, ambitious, professional, and very competitive individuals to fill part-time (with the option to go full-time at a later date) roles. Must be open to learning a new skillset and be coachable. Ready to add another stream of income, master personal finance, and impact their community through financial literacy.
* Qualifications:
* - Good to Excellent Communication Skills
* - Fluency in English or Multi-Lingual
* - Integrity
* - No Felony Offenses
* - Discipline
* - Motivation
* - Ability to study for and earn licenses
* Experience in the following fields preferred but NOT required:
* - Finance
* - Military
* - Customer Service
* - Barbering
* - Cosmetology
* - Sales
* - Banking
* - Accounting
* - Technical/Software
* - Education
* - Counseling

* - Train, coach, and develop new hires.
* Incentives:
* - Operate from any one of the 50 States.
* - Rewarding and meaningful work.
* - Fun, supportive, and motivating environment.
* - 1on1 mentorship. Online training.
* - Weekly coaching.
* - Positive and professional business partners and work environment.
* - Opportunity to be compensated well for all your efforts.
* - Promotions based on personal activity and only limited by you.
* Potential Compensation:
* UNCAPPED COMMISSIONS

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $24,236.07 - $50,534.00 per year

Expected hours: 6 – 10 per week

Benefits:

* Financial planning services
* Flexible schedule
* Opportunities for advancement
* Professional development assistance
* Profit sharing
* Referral program

Experience level:

* No experience needed

Application Question(s):

* Are you a U.S. Citizen?
* Do you reside in the United States full time?
* Are you open to the idea of being an entrepreneur and growing a business over time?
* Are you open to investing in your growth and development? Are you able to self-motivate?
* Do you believe that you have the capacity and potential to be coachable and learn a new skillset?
* Will a 100% commission-based, 1099 income opportunity, be a deal breaker for you?
* Are you willing to pay for a background check, and register for 215 Health, Life, Annuities License & Securities licenses?
* Are you open to working virtually and working as a team to generate interest and cultivate business opportunities?
* We offer a wide array of services to our clients. We support business owners, families and individuals. We offer: Financial needs analysis, asset management, estate planning (Wills and Trusts), advanced care directives, debt elimination and settlement, retirement planning, retirement accounts, retirement account rollovers, emergency savings, college savings plans, insurance planning, long-term care planning, and small business support: business legacy planning, succession planning, and 401Ks and insurance plans and more. All consultations are complimentary. Do you see value in these services?

Experience:

* Financial: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* series 215 life & health or securities licenses (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Loan Officer Partner
description:
Are you ready to take your career in the mortgage industry to the next level? Has the past year or two been a struggle on your own? Would you like to join a team without having to hunt for just new business? If so, we need to talk! We are looking for a dedicated partner to join our seasoned mortgage team. With over 20 years of experience as a loan officer in the industry, I have established a trusted name in the business, and am ready to expand our team with someone who shares our values of integrity, work ethic, and honesty.


We’re hiring for a full-time Loan Partner to work in tandem with the loan officer to properly package loans for our clients and get them mortgage-ready. The loan officer will cultivate new business while you analyze customer credit, review income, and assess documents to ensure a successful close.


This role is perfect for the detail-oriented self-starter who thrives on success. It is a commission-plus bonus position, however you will have access to our entire database to cultivate all current and new client deals. If you want to help people find their dream homes without the hassle of finding new leads, we need to talk. Our team will empower you to embrace your natural talents, and we’ll give you everything you need to achieve your career goals. Ready to start? Apply today!

**Compensation:**
$50,000 - $125,000 at plan yearly

**Responsibilities:*** Serve as the primary contact during the “contact to contract” phase of the loan process and liaison between clients, referral partners, and the loan officer and conduct meetings to coordinate any follow-up items
* Answer questions from customers or employees regarding transactions and give quotes when required to deliver excellent customer service
* Look over all loan package paperwork to check for inconsistencies, omissions, and inaccurate income calculations and then report any errors to the loan originator
* Orchestrate the completion of loan applications, coordinate the collection of documentation including credit reports, run DU/LP/AUS, prepare the file for processing, and send a closing cost worksheet to borrowers
* Create and nurture relationships with both referral partners and borrowers to draw in new business and retain our existing clients

**Qualifications:*** Strong understanding of mortgage loan products (FHA/VA/CONV/USDA) and knowledge of mortgage documentation, processes, and procedures
* Excellent time management, interpersonal, communication, and follow-up skills
* The ability to analyze credit reports, income, and asset documents, as well as an understanding of general ways to structure a loan
* Understands automated underwriting systems such as DU and LP

* 2+ Years of experience as a **licensed** Mortgage Loan Officer with a proven book of business or hands-on job experience at a minimum. You must currently be licensed, this is not an exception

**About Company**  

Our team focuses on 100% customer satisfaction. Our clients are THE most important thing to us. We strive to go above and beyond expectations. Erin has been a loan officer since 2003 and still has the passion to grow and develop along with her team. We are a family and continue to prosper due to the mutual respect and compassion we have as a team.

title: Paralegal or Mortgage Processor (Bankruptcy and Mortgage Modification)
PROCESSOR
description:
Overview:

Facilitate all aspects of loan processing from application receipt to underwriting and closing in accordance with company guidelines, policies and procedures.  

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:* Perform in-depth analysis of files for submission to underwriting and closing departments ensuring the required documentation is received and complete. Establish rapport with borrowers and deliver excellent customer service.
* Maintain system data including status and loan events (receipt of stipulations, dates and memos) with anticipation of closing each loan within 30 days.
* Order and review all required 3 party reports.
* Verify all documents and conditions have been met, obtain final approval sign off by underwriting, and confirm scheduled closing date.
* Resolve all loan level file issues to assist in funding the loan. Manage internal and external expectations on timelines, costs and processing. Assist with training new employees in the department.
* Follow company guidelines, policies and procedures.
* Complete special tasks as assigned by manager as needed.

  

SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES:* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong organizational and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency with MS Word and Excel.
* Ability to multi-task effectively in a fast-paced environment.
* Demonstrated knowledge of the mortgage documents and loan processing.

  

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE:* College degree preferred. Equivalent experience in mortgage banking origination may be a substitute.
* 3 years of residential processing experience preferred.
* Other relevant study or directly related work experience may be considered.
* Ability to work overtime (especially at the end of the month).

  

Certifications, Licenses, and/or Registration* NMLS# and license would be beneficial.

  

Physical Demands and Work Environment The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to handle, touch or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee frequently is required to talk and hear. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms. The employee is rarely required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
