title: Client Associate
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

The Client Reporting (CR) teams are comprised of highly dedicated and client experience focused individuals who are responsible for all aspects of the client reporting and data maintenance for Private Banking, Chase Wealth Management & JPMorgan Securities LLC accounts. The teams in Client Reporting are comprised of Statements (Quality & Corrections), Factsheet Oversight, Checkbook and Audit Confirmations. The team interacts with a variety of internal groups including, but not limited to, the Client Onboarding, Investors, Bankers, Middle Office, Client Services and Fiduciary in an effort to assist with client requests, inquiries and/or issues.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Managing a team size of minimum 5-7
* Ensure accurate and timely completion of operational procedures.
* Understand, follow and demonstrate compliance with all Risk and Control regulations.
* Work Allocation and monitoring.
* Escalation management
* Active involvement in and contribution to Global Projects / Local Initiatives.
* Assist and ensure a competitive and transparent work culture.
* Identify, evaluate and deliver process improvement initiatives.
* Manage and lead discussions on exceptional cases.

**Qualifications**

* Post Graduate / Graduate
* 6-8 years of relevant work experience
* Strong analytical and problem solving skills
* Escalate potential issues or concerns to management team
* Highly motivated with ability to work independently and in a team environment
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong interpersonal skills: can build effective business relationships with cross functional/geographical teams and coordinate with teams to action items.
* Adaptability: effectively organize and prioritize work to meet stringent deadlines.
* Aid in the development and management of an innovation driven work environment
* Commitment to quality and control
* Ability to think creatively and recommend/implement process improvements
* Strong organizational skills to successfully manage multiple tasks at one time
* Strong background in use of computer systems (PC and Mainframe)
* Knowledge of Private Bank products/services preferred
* Strong knowledge of Microsoft Applications, preferably Excel & Access Database


**ABOUT US**  

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  

  

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

  

  

  

**ABOUT THE TEAM**  

  

J.P. Morgan Asset & Wealth Management delivers industry-leading investment management and private banking solutions. Asset Management provides individuals, advisors and institutions with strategies and expertise that span the full spectrum of asset classes through our global network of investment professionals. Wealth Management helps individuals, families and foundations take a more intentional approach to their wealth or finances to better define, focus and realize their goals.

title: Opérateur
description:
**Description du poste**
------------------------

**Principal Responsibilities:**

* To ensure adequate and efficient services in matters relating to Operations.
* To provide support services in Financing and Trade Operations related matters to CASPL, Customers and Commercial and other business lines.

RBI/FEMA related knowledge


**Main Activities:**

* Forwarding/ Follow-up of transaction documents and ensure its timely execution at CASPL.
* Compliance with various provisions of FEMA and other statutes, Reserve Bank guidelines, Internal Procedures, Head Office guidelines and UCPDC, ISBP, URR, URC and any other provisions.
* Verification of availability adequate clear lines / balances for the customer under their respective authorization as well as authority of client signatures before processing of transactions
* Branch level processing of following Transactions in accordance with the laid down procedures and the respective check lists
* Letters of Credit
* Establishment/Amendment/Acceptances/Payments/ Cancellations
* Collection of Bills (inward ) and Co-acceptances
* Lodgement and Retirements etc.
* Buyer's credit /Supplier’s credit – Disbursements/Payments
* Guarantees – Issuance/Amendments/Cancellations/Invocations.
* Export/Outward documents
* Collection/Purchase/Discount/Negotiation
* Regular Follow up for acceptance and payment of bills under L/Cs and Collection
* Follow up and Collection of charges/ commission
* Advices/Presentation Memos to customers as provided by CASPL
* Verification of Physicals (Bills/Acceptances/Buyer’s Credits/LC/Guarantees)
* Bills of entry follow-up
* Recording of devolved L/c’s/invoked guarantees
* Follow up with Clients/Commercial for early payment of Overdue bills (Inward/Outward - Collection/Financed) under L/C or otherwise.
* Client Certificates related to the transaction approved by CASPL
* IFTT/OFTT/FOCC processing/monitoring/follow up
* Liason/Follow up with CASPL and other departments within the bank for the smooth conducting of Branch Business.
* Preparation and timely submission of any regulatory returns to Reserve Bank /
* Proper documentation / filing / scanning and orderly archiving of all transactions handled.
* Management/Monitoring of SharePoint

**Other Activities:**

* Exercise all authorities as per the Internal Delegation of Powers provided by the Bank.
* Exercise authority as per the Expenses Authorisation Policy, if applicable.
* Hold keys and perform all joint custodian functions as assigned.
* Any other jobs assigned by the Head- Operations/ Branches / COO

  
* **Critères de candidature**
---------------------------


	+ Date de prise de fonction
	+ 01/04/2024
	+ Poste avec management
	+ Non
	+ Niveau d'étude minimum
	+ Bac + 3 / L3
	+ Formation / Spécialisation
	+ FEDAI CERTIFICATION
	+ Niveau d'expérience minimum
	+ 6 - 10 ans
	+ Langues
	+ English
* **Entreprise Crédit Agricole CIB**
----------------------------------

A propos de Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank (Crédit Agricole CIB) Crédit Agricole CIB est la banque de financement et d'investissement du groupe Crédit Agricole, 10ème groupe bancaire mondial en taille de bilan 2021 (The Banker, juillet 2022). Près de 8600 collaborateurs répartis dans plus de 30 implantations en Europe, Amériques, Asie-Pacifique, Moyen-Orient et Afrique du Nord, accompagnent les clients de la Banque dans la couverture de leurs besoins financiers à travers le monde. Crédit Agricole CIB propose à ses clients grandes entreprises et institutionnels une gamme de produits et services dans les métiers de la banque de marchés, de la banque d'investissement, des financements structurés, de la banque commerciale et du commerce international. Pionnier dans le domaine de la finance Climat, la Banque occupe aujourd'hui une position de leader sur ce segment avec une offre complète pour l'ensemble de ses clients. La majorité des postes est éligible au télétravail dans les conditions prévues par notre accord reposant sur le double volontariat (collaborateur & manager) et après une période d'intégration réussie. Crédit Agricole CIB s'engage en faveur de l'insertion des personnes en situation de handicap, ainsi ce poste est ouvert à toutes et à tous. Pour plus d'information : www.ca-cib.fr Twitter: https://twitter.com/ca\\_cib LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/credit-agricole-cib/

title: Chief of Staff
description:
**Barclays Overview**


Barclays is a British universal bank. We are diversified by business, by different types of customers and clients, and by geography. Our businesses include consumer banking and payments operations around the world, as well as a top-tier, full service, global corporate and investment bank, all of which are supported by our service company which provides technology, operations and functional services across the Group.

  



**We are an equal opportunity employer and we are opposed to discrimination on any grounds.**

  



Working Flexibly

  



We’re committed to providing a supportive and inclusive culture and environment for you to work in. This environment recognises and supports ways to balance your personal needs, alongside the professional needs of our business. Providing the opportunity for all our employees, globally to work flexibly empowers each of us to work in a way that suits our lives as well as enabling us to better service our customers’ and clients’ needs. Whether you have family commitments or you’re a career, or whether you need study time or wish to pursue personal interests, our approach to working flexibly is designed to help you balance your life. If you would like some flexibility, then please discuss this with the hiring manager.

  



Hybrid Working

  

Structured hybrid role:

  

At Barclays, we offer a hybrid working experience that blends the positives of working alongside colleagues at our onsite locations, together with working from home. We have a structured approach where colleagues work at an onsite location on fixed, ‘anchor’, days of the week, for a minimum of two days a week or more, as set by the business area (or nearest equivalent if working part-time hours). Please discuss the working pattern requirements for the role you are applying for with the hiring manager. Please note that as we continue to embed our hybrid working environment, we remain in a test and learn phase, which means that working arrangements may be subject to change on reasonable notice to ensure we meet the needs of our business.

  



  

Overall purpose of role


The role holder will work closely with the Head of Barclays Private Bank Asia to deliver the business strategy across Private Clients India, Private Bank Singapore as well as the Global Indians business. The role involves supporting the effective management of the office of the Head of Private Bank Asia, driving business transformation across the above mentioned businesses and coordination of both BAU and strategic activities including include projects, governance, and employee communication.  


Key Accountabilities


**Chief of Staff**


* Define the commercial objectives and medium to long-term strategy for the Private Bank business in Asia. This should include considering internal and external factors such as available technology, competitive and regulatory environments, and the risk appetite of Barclays.


* Support the CEO is driving and executing the key priorities for the PB India, PB Singapore and Global Indians businesses, including platform enhancements, more robust governance, having an adequate sales management function in partnership with Finance.


* Owning key Management Team meetings and leadership forums – this would include the preparation of materials and the allocation of actions. The role holder would be expected to support the execution of key items which result from forums. Develop story boards for India CEO to communicate Business / Infrastructure strategy and progress update to various audiences within and outside the group.


* Support for the boards of all PB India legal entities – regulatory requirement. This would include being SME for legal entity capitalisation optimization across all PB India entities.


* Engagement with Corporate and Investment Bank partners to support more deal flow and supporting key transactions to completion.


* Partner with HR for a complete colleague agenda including training and development programmes, D&I initiatives, and Well-being.


**Business Transformation and Commercial Management**


* Drive the business transformation strategy across PB India, PB Singapore and the Global Indians businesses.


* Run key PB India and PB Singapore projects that will strengthen the platform for the next phase of growth.


* Drive business and market intelligence to support the sales and product teams.


* Efficiently manage and drive the Global Indians business and effectively coordinate with offshore PB locations to ensure a joined up approach.


* Rigorous and active management of the sales process.


* Support the Head of Sales/Distribution in India and Singapore in coaching and mentoring the teams on sales management and prospect management.


Strategic Execution and Support


* The role holder will work with the Private Bank Leadership team to drive the Private Bank agenda. The role holder will be expected to understand the wider implications and impacts of initiatives across the business and group and work with senior stakeholders to highlight and address any issues.


* The role holder will also be expected to manage the delivery of all Monthly Business Reviews, Management Forums coupled with any Leadership events & Town halls.


Communication


* The role holder will be expected to manage the development of key presentations, and employee communications materials (including Townhalls, monthly all-staff communications, key projects). They will also be required to provide high-quality written and/or oral briefings to Private Bank Asia Head ahead of trips and external commitments.


Operational Management


* The role holder will work with internal stakeholders (including Communications and Events teams) to ensure the adequate planning of both internal and external events, as well as anticipating requirements for upcoming commitments. They will further be responsible for managing client meetings and contact with the Head of Private Bank Asia, including drafting responses to client correspondence, overseeing outstanding complaints and obtaining briefing documents. In this context, they will be expected to manage key processes within the team, and proactively look for areas where efficiency could be created.

  



Decision-making and Problem Solving


Deep analytical skills required to evaluate opportunities arising from banker and product team interactions and MI data across the firm.  

Risk and Control Objective
Ensure that all activities and duties are carried out in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework and internal Barclays Policies and Policy Standards.

  



Person Specification


* Broad experience of the financial services industry is essential, particularly in the areas of regulated products and services to high-net-worth clients and/or asset management.


* Entrepreneurial spirit but also with a collegiate approach


* High levels of integrity and able to quickly form positive working relationship with others.


* Organised and disciplined in approach.


* Ability to work in partnership with stakeholders.


Essential Skills/Basic Qualifications:


* Graduate

  



Desirable skills/Preferred Qualifications:


* MBA/CA

  



Purpose, Values **and Mindset**
We deploy finance responsibly to support people and businesses, acting with empathy and integrity, championing innovation and sustainability, for the common good and the long term.  

Our values underpin everything we do: Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and Stewardship.  

Respect


We harness the power of diversity and inclusion in our business, trust those we work with, and value everyone's contribution.
Integrity


We operate with honesty, transparency and fairness in all we do.


Service


We act with empathy and humility, putting the people and businesses we serve at the centre of what we do.
Excellence


We champion innovation, and use our energy, expertise and resources to make a positive difference.


Stewardship


We prize sustainability, and are passionate about leaving things better than we found them.

  

Our Mindset shapes how we take action, living by our Values, driven by our Purpose, always with our customers and clients at the heart of what we do; our Mindset is to Empower, Challenge and Drive.


Empower


Trust and support each other to deliver. Make decisions with those closest to the topic. Include diverse perspectives. Celebrate success and learn from failure.
Challenge


Question whether things can be done better. Use insights based on data to inform decisions. Be curious about how we can adapt and improve. Speak up and be open to alternative viewpoints.


Drive


Focus on outcomes. Deliver with pace. Be passionate and ambitious about what we do. Take personal responsibility. Actively build collaborative relationships to get things done.

Within the group, is nestled a boutique law firm, rendering quality services in the field of Company Law, Insolvency Law, Securities Laws & FEMA, Corporate Restructuring, Corporate Taxation, Global Business Setup, Compliance Management, Documentation, and Regulatory Approvals. The Group also offers Investment Banking, Transaction Advisory, Valuation, and Business Modelling services through Corporate Professionals Capital Private Limited, a SEBI Registered (Category-I) Merchant Banker. With the changing legal and regulatory regime, the Group CP has been adding new services and products in its fold to provide holistic solutions to its clients. IBBI has recently registered "Corporate Professionals Valuation Services Pvt. Ltd. as India's 6th IBBI registered Valuer Entity".

The Group with its focus on serving the clients with utmost efficiency integrates its knowledge and expertise with Information Technology to customize the products and offers path-breaking solutions to meet their business strategies. The Group has expertise in dealing with complicated transactions and has completed more than 10000 assignments of over 1000 Corporate Houses, comprising both domestic and multi-national companies. title: Vice President of Sales
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION** **About J.P. Morgan Trade & Working Capital:**


J.P. Morgan's Trade & Working Capital (T&WC) division, a key part of Payments and an essential aspect of our Commercial & Investment Bank client relationships, is seeking talented candidates for a Trade Sales position in Mumbai. We provide financing and risk mitigation products to our Corporate and Commercial banking clients, including Supply Chain Finance, Trade Loans, and more. As part of the world's largest cash management provider, we help companies manage working capital and liquidity in over 40 countries. Join us and be part of a team that processes an average of $6 trillion in transactions daily.

**Job Summary****:**


J.P. Morgan is seeking talented candidates for a position as Trade Sales, within Trade & Working Capital, based in Mumbai.


As a Vice President within Trade & Working Capital, you will primarily be responsible for Senior Trade Sales Coverage to Corporate and Commercial banking clients across West India. Your role will involve developing a clear roadmap to meet financial targets and enhance client experiences. You will collaborate extensively with various teams such as Global Corporate Bankers, Operations, Technology, Legal, Compliance, Risk, Finance, Tax, Credit, Implementations, Product, and Customer Service to meet client requirements. You will lead and manage client initiatives, taking ownership of high-impact client interactions and engagements. This role provides an excellent opportunity to work in a dynamic environment and make a significant impact on our clients' businesses.


This role will be based in Mumbai.

**Job responsibilities:**

* Manage relationship on Trade Sales products with identified /key clients portfolio including prospecting and deepening client relationship.
* Develop & manage strategy to meet Business results - revenue growth and New sales targets for Trade Finance products
* Coordinate with Corporate Bankers and other LOBs with respect to developing business and cross-sell opportunities with clients.
* Ensure that business is operating in full compliance with local market standards and the Firm wide requirements
* Help roll out new products to achieve revenue growth and maximize market penetration.
* Provide input into product development, marketing, and other strategic initiative.
* Identify solutions & programs for the business which will ensure J.P. Morgan Trade product /services are at par and meet client requirements.
* Communicate effectively client priorities locally & regionally within Trade Finance business
* Have intensive client focus, Identify challenges and develop solutions
* Identify potential issues and process inefficiencies and escalate accordingly within the Risk and Control framework;
* Work with Marketing, Product Management, and Global Trade partners to deliver best-in-class external materials and engagements. Represent JPMC's Global Trade capabilities at internal and external events.




**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:**

* Masters (MBA) from a reputed Institute or Chartered Accountant or equivalent degree
* Minimum 8 years working experience with trade products and managing clients
* In depth knowledge of Traditional Trade and Structured Trade products - Supply Chain Finance, ECA financing
* Excellent written and strong presentation skills and strong analytical and execution skills
* Experience in handling documentation negotiation
* Experience in commercial, credit process, corporate and/or transactional banking.
* Experience in working in a matrix structure and with cross-border teams
* Able to communicate and interact effectively with people at all levels
* Self-directed, highly motivated, and able to work independently to deliver in a timely and accurate manner; strong attention to detail
* Proven track record of results-oriented performance; building and influencing strategic relationships; ability to lead and influence others
* Capable of working with minimal supervision


**ABOUT US**  

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  

  

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

  

  

  

**ABOUT THE TEAM**  

  

The Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.

### **Job Description**

**What you’ll do:**  

* Participate in the entire backend system development life cycle, from conceptualization and design to testing and deployment.
* Write efficient, clean, and maintainable code, adhering to coding standards and best practices.
* Continuously research and stay updated with the latest backend development trends, tools, and technologies.
* Assist in maintaining code repositories and version control using tools like Git.
* Collaborate with front-end developers and UI/UX designers to ensure seamless integration and optimal performance.

**What makes you a great fit:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
* A genuine passion for backend development and a keen interest in scalable systems.
* Basic understanding of prominent backend languages like Golang, Python, Node.js, and others.
* Familiarity with backend architectures, frameworks, and best practices.
* Proficiency with development tools, server management, and database systems.
* Strong problem-solving skills and analytical thinking.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to thrive in a collaborative team environment.
* Previous experience with personal or academic backend projects is a plus.
* Knowledge of system scalability principles and design patterns is advantageous.
### **About Juleo**


Juleo is a Delhi NCR based Applied AI & Consumer Tech company tackling one of the largest unsolved consumer internet problems of our time. We are a motley crew of smart, passionate and nice people who believe you can build a high performing company with a culture of respect aka a sports team with a heart aka a caring meritocracy. Our illustrious backers include unicorn founders, serial entrepreneurs with exits, tech & consumer industry stalwarts and investment professionals/bankers. title: Designer
description:
**Roles and Responsibilities:**  



**Strategizing and Planning**  



· Ensure that an appropriate design tools, software and resources are available to achieve TEAM businesses drivers.  

  



· Present Technical advancement, update in existing methods, process, procedures, standards and other rules and regulations to the management. Prepare necessary budget for annual investment.  

  



· To adopt the technological changes in designing, project engineering, for accuracy in design and timely delivery of design to customers and release for manufacturing.  

  



**Mechanical Design and Detailed Engineering**  



· Study and understand the customer data sheets, specification and standards.  

  



· Complete the mechanical design calculations using PV Elite, HTRI, Nozzle PRO and Code-calc and detailed engineering to estimation for submitting competitive estimation and proposal to customers in preorder stage and design the equipment, check and release drawings for manufacturing after obtaining an approval from the customers.  

  



  

  

  

  

**Obtaining Customer Approval**  



· Coordinate for approval of design documents from customers / clients, Authorised Inspector (AI), Professional Engineers (PE), Indian Boiler Regulations (IBR) competent person, petroleum & Explosive Safety Organizations (PESO) as applicable to proceed for manufacturing.  

  



**Materials take-off**  



· Design, Check and release of materials take-off for long lead items such as plates, forgings, tubes, fittings, pipes, and gaskets.  

  



**Design Change Request and Change Review**  



· Technically review the design change request from the manufacturing, quality and execution team and approve as appropriate without deviating the customer specification, codes, and standards.  

  



**Resolving Technical Queries**  



· Understand the customer specification and meeting the Codes requirement, standards and procedures to resolve the queries raised by the customers.  

  



**Change Claims – Post Orders changes by customers** .  

  



· Review the design change request raised by internal departments, necessary change claim should be discussed with the customers, prepare, and submit the claim with the customers.  

  



· Review the post order requirements from the customers, make calculations, prepare the design.  

  



· Prepare necessary change claim for the post order changes by customers. Ensure the change claims are approved and share shared with the PMO team  

  



**Inputs to Procurement**  



· Timely issue of TDC - Technical Delivery Condition to PPC and Purchase for material procurement.  

  



**Post Drawing Documentation**  



· Issue of Transport sketch before 2 months from the date of dispatch.  

  



· Submission of Weld map and final As-Built drawing within 5 days from the date of drawing submission.  

  



**ASME and other Audits**  



· Prepare, update and implement ASME requirements for audit. Follow guidelines for the design, fabrication, inspection and testing as required.  

  



  

**Team management**  



· Performance review for continual improvement  

  



· Encourage team to take up challenging tasks  

  



· Offer coaching support to the team  

  



· Support team in developing career path and IDPs  

  



· Develop successors to the critical/key roles  

  



· To conduct periodic departmental meetings to foster oneness and commitment to the vision/goals.  

  



**Relationship Management**  



· Protects the interests of stake holders and maintain healthy networking with all the stake holders (E.g., Customers/Suppliers/ / Employees / Shareholders /Society/ Auditors / Third Parties / Statutory authorities / Bankers / Government etc.)  

  



· Internal coordinates- with all the internal functions.  

  



· Take opportunities to demonstrate the reliability and ethics, honoring commitments and demonstrating high standards of behavior  

  



· Establishes a climate where ideas are openly exchanged.  

  



  

  

### **Requirements**

Position Name: Deputy General Manager / General Manager- Design  

  



Reports to: Vice President- Operations  

  



Direct Reports: 2  

  



Work Location: Vandalur, Chennai  

  



Department: Design  

  



Designation: DGM / GM  

  



Band: DH Band  

  



Experience: 15 – 18 years  

  



Qualification: BE/ BTech/ ME / M Tech or + MBA would be added advantage  

  



  

  

### **Benefits**

Industrial Standards

title: Accountant
description:
We are looking for a chartered accountant to support our Office Administration, Accounting, and compliance with local laws and regulations. The Chartered Accountant will support accounting operations teams across our three India locations. We outsource our bookkeeping and payroll. As a part of accounting operations, you will support our external partners by providing required invoices, payment records, and supporting documents. As a part of the team, you will also support capital and operating expenses exceeding two hundred crore Rupees per year. In partnership with the external payroll processing provider, you will also work on preparing and finalizing payroll for over 1,000 employees every month. Based on your expertise, you may also receive exposure to financial analysis relating to the setup of new companies, business operating models, and government incentives for investments.

Due to the fast-paced and distributed nature of our projects, our company plans to appoint one Professional Chartered Account to support our fast-paced operations in MUMBAI.

Key result areas as a percentage of overall work items will be:

**Financial Analysis (10%)**

* Help review company structure (LLP versus Private Limited, etc.) and simplify operations.
* Analyze government incentives and payment plans to maximize Internal Rate of Return (IRR) and project Net Present Value (NPV).
* Prepare reports and presentation from Managerial Accounting point of view (strategic and big picture point of view versus audit point of view).

**Compliances (20%)**

* Ensure compliance with the requirements of SEZ, customs, and other government bodies.
* Ensure legal compliance for wages, PF, ESI, and Shops and Establishment Act, etc. for contract resources in all offices.
* Renew licenses under the Shops & Establishment Act and maintain all the records.

**Accounting Operations (25%)**

* Manage banking activities and relationship with our bankers. Review internal audit reports to ensure financial compliance.
* Create and maintain cash flow statement, and monthly/quarterly/annual budgets. Ensure financial statements are completed accurately and resolve any differences or issues.
* Manage petty cash process and transactions, including reimbursement for employees.

**Vendor management (25%)**

* Lead the price and service negotiations and manage all key agreements/contracts for all the company offices in India. This includes, catering, housekeeping, landlord/ rental relationships, security, and all other contractors.
* Lead the procurement activities for all offices by analyzing prices, timeliness, and quality.
* Prepare Pay Orders, manage procurements and ensure on-time delivery. Support international and domestic travel, visa, currency, ticket & accommodation arrangements for company employees & visitors.
* Establish and maintain hard copy and electronic filing systems for departmental data, documents, and other materials.

**Payroll Support (20%)**

* Review the salary input files for all the company offices in India.
* Coordinate with the payroll agency to ensure accurate salary disbursements.
* Support the HR team for financial and taxation related queries.

**Candidate Profile**: Qualifications should include:

* Chartered Accountant
* Ability to travel to various government offices in Mumbai
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and newer online tools
* Excellent analytical and communication skills (English medium schooling)

**Experience:** Minimum of 1 years.

**Compensation:** Our company will offer a fixed monthly professional fee (not a salary)

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: ₹100,000.00 - ₹130,000.00 per month

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Private Banker
description:
Job Title:

  

Private Banker (Singapore)

  

  

Primary Location:

  

Singapore


  

Hybrid Working


Structured hybrid role:

  

At Barclays, we offer a hybrid working experience that blends the positives of working alongside colleagues at our onsite locations, together with working from home. We have a structured approach where colleagues work at an onsite location on fixed, ‘anchor’, days of the week, for a minimum of two days a week or more, as set by the business area (or nearest equivalent if working part-time hours). Please discuss the working pattern requirements for the role you are applying for with the hiring manager. Please note that as we continue to embed our hybrid working environment, we remain in a test and learn phase, which means that working arrangements may be subject to change on reasonable notice to ensure we meet the needs of our business.

  



  

**About Private Bank**


As the Private Bank we bring the breadth and scale of what we do as a banking group to our individual clients, channelling this know-how and reaching out across our network to unlock broader capabilities. Our track record includes leading access to market opportunities and financing from the Investment and Corporate Bank, strong historical performance of discretionary investments against industry benchmarks, and unrivalled access to philanthropy advice to highlight just a few.


**Key Accountabilities**


* The role holder will engage with UHNW and Family Office clients who are typically multi-banked with multi-jurisdictional and often complex banking and investment requirements and succesfully attract them to execute or place their business with Barclays Private Bank and the wider Barclays Group.


* The role holder will identify, develop and secure new relationships through personal and client referrals, Barclays group internal networks and corporate and investment banking sources


* The role holder is expected to onboard new clients of the appropriate calibre and size to deliver business growth for the Private Bank and provide clients with the solutions and services that meet their needs


* The role holder in their day-to-day activity, using their breadth of experience will facilitate delivery of the right client solutions for sophisticated multi-jurisdiction, multi banked clients with complex banking and investment requirements

  

**Risk and Control Objective**
Take ownership for managing risk and strengthening controls in relation to the work you do


**Investment Advice and Financial Solutions**

* The role holder will provide clients and prospective clients with access to and solutions drawn from the Private Bank product set which shall include:


* Investment Management: This shall include modelled and bespoke discretionary portfolios together with advised transactions into the full range of authorised investment products including publicly listed securities, mutual funds, structured products, hedge funds, private equity, commodities, real estate, FX products and private assets.


**Investment Advice and Financial Solutions**

* The role holder will provide clients and prospective clients with access to and solutions drawn from the Private Bank product set which shall include:


o Investment Management: This shall include modelled and bespoke discretionary portfolios together with advised transactions into the full range of authorised investment products including publicly listed securities, mutual funds, structured products, hedge funds, private equity, commodities, real estate, FX products and private assets.
o Balance Sheet: Banking and Credit to support a wide range of clients deposit and borrowing needs including Securities Backed Lending and Mortgage Finance for UK residential & commercial property.
o Wealth Advisory: Faciltating access to Private Bank Wealth Advisors where clients have need of wealth planning and structuring services including trust and estate planning.
o Corporate & Investment Banking: Enable clients to access products and services traditionally available only to institutional clients, through the Strategic Sales Group (SSG)
**Essential Skills/Basic Qualifications:**


* The role holder will have very strong relationship skills with experience of managing and handling the sophisticated needs of individuals and families


* The role holder will have experience of building a substantial client base using internal and external networks, be effective in gaining an in-depth understanding of client’s needs and advising on a diverse range of wealth management solutions with high penetration ratios per client.


**Desirable skills/Preferred Qualifications****:**


* The role holder will have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, will have an entrepreneurial spirit and a collegiate approach.
* The role holder will be able to embrace challenges and evolve their strategy as the business environment develops.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.
Job Description
As a Data Scientist you will be working with the largest repository of corporate, board-level business information in the world. You will work with Product Managers, Business Analysts, Data Analysts, User Experience Designers, ML Engineers, and Senior Executives to gather requirements and apply data science methodologies to solve complex business problems.
You should have deep expertise in analyzing large, complex data sets from multiple domains, then translating this analysis to models which can run at scale in a SaaS business. You will be a part of an established global team focused on Analytics, Search and Artificial Intelligence with researchers in developers in Waltham, MA, Bucharest, Romania and Hyderabad, India all focused on the development of solutions for Investment Bankers, Private Equity and other industries.*Responsibilities & Opportunities of the Role:** Work with the AI team in building a world-class software, functioning as a thought leader in ensuring team development efforts resulting in successful delivery of AI systems.
* Collaborate with cross functional agile teams of software engineers, data engineers, ML engineers, Product Managers and others in building new product features
* Manage and execute entire data projects from start to finish including cross-functional project management, data gathering and manipulation, analysis and modeling, and communication of insights and recommendations.
* Demonstrate a high degree of originality and creativity when developing solutions to solve problems like entity recognition, document classification etc. utilizing methods such as statistical analysis, regression modeling, natural language understanding and optimization, and deep learning.
* Work independently to manage multiple projects at once while ensuring deadlines are met and data output is accurate and appropriate for the business. Must also be able to deal with ambiguity and make independent decisions about what data and approach is best for the task at hand.
* Think strategically about data as a core enterprise asset and assist in all phases of the advanced analytic development process
* Support advanced analytical and data mining efforts which could include but not limited to clustering, segmentation, logistic and multivariate regression, decision/CART trees, neural networks, time-series analysis, sentiment analysis, topic modeling, random forests, and Bayesian analysis.
* The scope of work includes Forecast, Prediction Models, Outlier Reporting, Risk Analysis, Document classification, Data Extraction, Adhoc analysis.
* Implementation of Supervised and Unsupervised model development techniques

*Experience:** A minimum of 2 years of developing and running models in non-academic production systems. Please note that applications without this experience will not be considered. Some of this experience needs to with NLP and deep learning technologies.
* Masters or Ph.D. with experience in Machine Learning/Statistics/Data Science
* Experience with traditional as well as modern machine learning/statistical techniques, including Regression, Classification, Regularization, NLP, NLU, Ensemble Methods and Neural Networks
* Strong implementation experience with high-level languages, such as Python, R, Perl, Ruby, Scala or similar scripting languages.
* Familiarity with Linux/Unix/Shell environments.
* Strong hands-on skills in sourcing, cleaning, manipulating and analyzing large volumes of data.
* Strong written and oral communication skills.
* Intense intellectual curiosity – strong desire to always be learning
* Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving open-ended problems
* Highly collaborative, team-player attitude
* Experience with product development is a plus
* Experience with Financial Services is desired but not required. Much of our data relates to Investment Banking and M&A.

*Technical Skills:** Technical Skills: SAS &/or R &/or SPSS, Python, Hadoop, SQL, NoSQL, Unstructured Data, SQL, SparkSQL (or equivalent Big Data Language), Expert at MS Excel, XML, Data Visualization Tensorflow, Kubeflow, Anaconda, PyCharm, SciPy, Keras, Scikit, NLTK, SpaCY.
* Tool Experience (such as Tableau), XML, Web Services, Java, &/or Perl &/or Python &/or C/C++, RESTful Services and APIs, Testing and Debugging, Data Munging/Cleanup, Data Visualization and Communication.
* Experience with ML systems using frameworks such as Scikit-learn, Keras and Tensorflow.
* Technical/SDLC: General Agile experience, Strong SCRUM, Confluence, Jira, Version Control.
* Strong Presentation skills.
* Experience in business intelligence systems is a plus.
* Strong business acumen and financial services experience is a plus.


Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, dental, 401k plan, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.

title: Business Development Executive
description:
**Job Description Company:** 

G C Limited is a Category I Merchant Banker registered with the SEBI and aims to provide a one-stop solution for various investment banking & advisory services. It provides array of services for listed and unlisted companies; such as Valuations, Issue Management (i.e. SME & Main Board IPOs), Open Offers, Corporate Advisory, and Debt Syndication.

**Location:** Pune

**Designation:** Associate – Business Development.

**CTC:** INR 2.40 – 2.62 lakhs (Depending upon candidate).

**Responsibilities:** Business development associate is responsible for helping grow businesses by finding new opportunities, researching leads, establishing relationships with potential clients. We expect the Candidate to be responsible, honest, dedicated, and a thorough professional.

Candidate shall also be responsible for:

1. Develop a thorough understanding of the Company’s Services and client categories.

2. Assisting in preparation of Teaser, Newsletter, and Presentation.

3. Assisting in generating new Leads with the help of different sources and networking (eg. BNI, Social Media channels like LinkedIn, Common Contacts of self, colleagues and seniors).

4. Conduct cold calls to prospective clients with the aim of generating new business leads. Engage potential clients in meaningful conversations to understand their needs and present our services effectively. Creating Funnels of contacts of Prospective Clients & Professionals and regular followups. Work collaboratively with the business development team to transition qualified leads. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all interactions with potential clients.

5. Identifying Prospective Clients & Professionals, attending meetings, and giving presentations independently.

6. Maintenance of Calendar - Maintenance of all Contacts and Meetings.

7. Staying up-to-date with various updates and movements in the financial markets. 8. Attending Seminars, Webinars, and Social Events.

9. Scheduling Interviews and Meetings as per requirement with the help of Agencies and social media.

10. Developing growth strategies and plans.

11. Developing promotional campaigns around major services of the company.

12. Developing goals for the development team and business growth and ensuring they are met.

13. Tracking Competitors activities and providing valuable inputs for fine-tuning marketing strategies.

14. Any other role/responsibility (if any) as demanded from the Candidate by the management during Candidate’s tenure.

**Requirements:**

1. Qualification: Any graduation degree in Commerce stream.

2. Proven work experience as a Business Development team or similar role (Atleast 1 year) in the Consultancy sector like CA Firm, CS Firm, or Business Consultancy Firm.

3. Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and Hands-on experience with Social Media Platforms (e.g. LinkedIn).

4. Pleasant personality, professional attitude, and appearance.

5. Strong communication skills and IT fluency.

6. Travelling for meetings.

7. Proficiency in English language.

8. Ability to be resourceful and proactive.

9. Excellent organizational skills.

10. Multitasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.

11. Ability to self-motivate.

12. Experience working to and exceeding targets.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

* Day shift
* Morning shift

* Performance bonus

title: Junior Account Executive
description:

· Monitor and guide accurate documentation of financial records of invoices, bills, etc.

· Preparation of monthly MIS after ensuring proper closure of books.

· Prepare Balance sheets, Income statements and Cash flow statements. Provide a detailed analysis of each to management.

· Create and maintain AR statement. Drive communication and collaboration with sales, operations and procurement teams on collection updates, credit release and overdue accounts.

· Create and maintain AP statement. Collaborate with purchase and operations team to optimise working capital.

· Maintain a fixed asset register.

· Ensure a record of stock and inventory of products and various materials is maintained. Perform stock audits on a regular basis.

· Help sales and operations team by performing credit reports of potential customers, ensuring to minimise risk.

· Establishes internal controls and guidelines for cost reduction, revenue enhancement, cashflow management and profit maximization.

· Analyze costs of raw materials and other supplies and create cost-benefit analyses for changing vendors.

· Review rates of labour and overhead and suggest policy changes to improve profits.

· Create a semi-annual company budget in coordination with management and track expenditure ensuring its within budget.

· Create project reports and conduct risk analysis/feasibility assessments for future investments.

· Liaison with bankers, external auditors and tax consultants.

· Assist in preparing TDS, GST & Income tax fillings and ensure that filings are completed on time.

· Ensure bank statement reconciliations are performed daily.

We are willing to train people in these areas if the candidate is otherwise qualified:

Culture requirement

The ideal candidate has the following approach to work:

· Work Style: Detail oriented

· Emotional Disposition: Patient.

· Professional Values: Organised, punctual and ethical.

**Keys to this Hire**

· Excellent accounting acumen and bookkeeping practices.

title: Fundraising Manager
description:
As an Investment Banker, you will play a pivotal role in executing and advising on complex financial transactions for clients. Institutional Fund Raising techniques from the clients.

This position requires a deep understanding of financial markets, strong analytical skills, and the ability to provide strategic financial guidance to clients. You will be responsible for managing various aspects of transactions, from financial analysis and modeling to deal execution and client relationship management.

**ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**

**1. Financial Analysis and Modeling:**

* Conduct comprehensive financial analyses, including DCF, CCA, and PTA, to evaluate potential investment opportunities.
* Develop and maintain sophisticated financial models to assess the impact of different scenarios on client outcomes.
* Provide insightful financial recommendations based on analysis.

**2. Transaction Execution:**

* Lead and support the execution of mergers and acquisitions, IPOs, debt and equity offerings, and other corporate finance transactions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless execution, including legal, tax, and regulatory experts.
* Manage the due diligence process, coordinating information gathering and analysis.

**3. Client Relationship Management:**

* Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their financial goals and objectives.
* Provide strategic financial advice to clients, aligning recommendations with their long-term business strategies.
* Identify opportunities for additional financial services and contribute to business development efforts.

**4. Pitching and Presentation:**

* Develop compelling pitches and presentations to showcase the bank's capabilities and propose tailored financial solutions.
* Create and maintain pitch books and presentation materials for client meetings.
* Effectively communicate complex financial concepts to clients and stakeholders.

**5. Market Research and Analysis:**

* Stay informed about market trends, economic indicators, and industry developments.
* Provide clients with insights on market conditions and potential impacts on their financial strategies.
* Contribute to the development of thought leadership and market research reports.

**6. Regulatory Compliance:**

* Stay current on financial regulations and ensure all transactions comply with relevant legal and regulatory requirements.
* Collaborate with legal teams to navigate regulatory challenges and mitigate risks.

**7. Negotiation:**

* Participate in negotiations with clients, counterparties, and other stakeholders to achieve favorable terms for transactions.
* Advocate for the client's interests while maintaining a balanced approach to negotiations.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: ₹70,000.00 - ₹125,000.00 per month

Benefits:

* Cell phone reimbursement
* Health insurance

title: Management Analyst
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  



**Job title**


CIB - Centralized Research Group (CRG) – M&A Business Management


**Short description**


This role is focused on Business Management (BM) for Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A); You will work closely with senior bankers in the M&A BM team in NY in doing analysis / presentations to provide insights for the senior management in M&A – track the M&A markets, new deals in market / pipeline, league tables, slice and dice the data across M&A data to understand underlying themes, help on various initiatives for the senior management.




**Posting description**


The Centralized Research Group (CRG) is part of CIB R&A covering Banking globally. It works closely with the firm’s Investment Banking (IB), Commercial Banking (CB) and Global Corporate Banking (GCB) teams offering customized financial solutions across Mergers & Acquisitions, Equity / Debt capital raising, Credit, Treasury, Cash Management, Trade, and Markets, among others.




This role is focused on Business Management (BM) for Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A); You will work closely with senior bankers in the M&A BM team in NY in doing analysis / presentations to provide insights for the senior management in M&A – track the M&A markets, new deals in market / pipeline, league tables, slice and dice the data across M&A data to understand underlying themes, help on various initiatives for the senior management.




**Job responsibilities**

* Assist in preparing weekly, monthly and quarterly materials for the team, consisting of various trends and key deals in the period, etc.
* Preparing league tables, credentials and other standard pages
* Analyze financial and business performance and provide key insights to senior management
* Provide a high level of responsiveness to ad-hoc requests that address the needs of senior management
* Working on preparing themes, based on research and other specific research requirements as required
* Assist on various MIS and internal initiatives and come up with creative solutions that address the needs of senior management
* Fee / wallet analysis – provide key insights on fees from deals announced / in pipeline. Maintaining key knowledge management databases for ready to use slides / data in marketing materials




**Required qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* Bachelor / Master’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or other related area
* Knowledge of Dealogic database
* Basic understanding of Investment Banking / M&A markets with strong quantitative and analytical skills
* Excellent communication skills with ability to effectively interact with senior professionals / key stakeholders and ability to operate in a lean team structure
* Ability to find / source information from different sources and work on large amount of data
* Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills

**Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* Relevant work experience in BM, M&A, Banking domain
* Ability to adapt to non-standard requests independently with minimal guidance and manage time when faced with multiple urgent tasks
* Proactive, highly organized with strong attention to details
* Ability to multitask several projects, have a keen eye for detail and deliver quality under pressure




**ABOUT US**  

  

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.  


We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.  

  

  

**ABOUT THE TEAM**  

  

The Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.

title: Tax Manager
description:
Job Description
 Tax Manager -US International Compliance
At EisnerAmper, we look for individuals who welcome new ideas, encourage innovation, and are eager to make an impact. Whether you’re starting out in your career or taking your next step as a seasoned professional, the EisnerAmper experience is one-of-a-kind. You can design a career you’ll love from top to bottom – we give you the tools you need to succeed and the autonomy to reach your goals.
We are seeking a Manager to join the International Tax practice in our Mumbai, Bangalore, and Hyderabad offices. We are seeking someone who thrives in a growing environment and providing clients with exceptional services.
What it Means to Work for EisnerAmper:* You will get to be part of one of the largest and fastest growing accounting and advisory firms in the industry
* You will have the flexibility to manage your days in support of our commitment to work/life balance
* You will join a culture that has received multiple top “Places to Work” awards
	+ We believe that great work is accomplished when cultures, ideas and experiences come together to create new solutions
	+ We understand that embracing our differences is what unites us as a team and strengthens our foundation
	+ Showing up authentically is how we, both as professionals and a Firm, find inspiration to do our best work
	+ Numerous Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to support our Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion (DE&I) efforts


What Work You Will be Responsible For:* Delivering a full range of international tax services in compliance with laws and regulations within timeframe.
* Building relationships and interacting with clients to provide excellent planning, consultation and expert knowledge.
* Providing tax planning, and reviewing complex International US tax Forms 5471, 5472, 8865, 8858s etc.
* Conduct GILTI calculations for foreign corporations, including Subpart F, E&P, section 987, and foreign tax credits calculations.
* Review and managing of the above listed forms and supporting Work papers as per US Tax Law


Compliances for: All International filling compliances* You will be involved in all aspects of tax assignments from planning and projections to finalization.
* You will be responsible to identify tax issues and propose potential solutions to resolve them.
* You will have an opportunity to work directly with the clients and provide exemplary client service to exceeds their expectations.
* As a part of our client's serving team, you will have an opportunity to work seamlessly with US counter parts by utilizing our state-of-the-art technology and electronic office tools and processes.
* Stay informed about emerging trends and developments in international taxation and share knowledge with colleagues and clients through training sessions and internal communications.
* Coordinate with other departments, such as transfer pricing, tax controversy, and finance, to ensure alignment and integration of international tax strategies with overall business objectives.
* Excellent opportunity to learn complex tax issues affecting US and Global investment Companies.
* Lead and develop staff and participate in the performance review process
* Oversee the implementation of OIT (International Tax) software to streamline processes and enhance efficiency in tax compliance and planning.
* Volunteer for our firm’s technology initiatives.
* Impart training to new joiners as well to other team members


Basic qualifications for the opportunity* Bachelor’s degree in accounting or equivalent field is required
* 7+ years of progressive US/Global taxation experience
* CPA, CA or Enrolled Agent is required
* Experience working directly with clients and/or global counterparts
* Experience working with clients
* Update team with tax law changes and implement new processes and strategies


We strongly believe in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, EisnerAmper is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or protected veteran status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics under federal, state, or local law.
About Our Tax Team:
As the largest service line within the firm, EisnerAmper’s Tax Group does not only provide trusted and innovative tax solutions to its clients, but it creates new opportunities for employees to grow, both personally and professionally. With a range of specialties based on location and industry, employees have the flexibility to focus on the work they want to do and the autonomy to shape their careers in a fulfilling way.
A hybrid between a general tax practice and a hyper-specialized firm, our culture is based on collaboration, innovation, and transparency. For us, success is defined by working together, sometimes across specialties, to provide the best tax solutions to meet our clients’ unique needs.
Tax regulations and procedures are always changing, and so are we. All EisnerAmper tax employees are empowered to challenge the status quo by thinking outside the box and bringing new ideas to the table. Because when we can identify creative ways to reduce filing turnarounds or streamline compliance work, we're able spend more time conducting impactful business advisory services for our clients.
About EisnerAmper:
EisnerAmper is one of the largest accounting, tax, and business advisory firms, with nearly 4,000 employees and more than 350 partners across the world. We combine responsiveness with a long-range perspective; to help clients meet the pressing issues they face today and position them for success tomorrow.
Our clients are enterprises as diverse as sophisticated financial institutions and start-ups, global public firms, and middle-market companies, as well as high net worth individuals, family offices, not-for-profit organizations, and entrepreneurial ventures across a variety of industries. We are also engaged by the attorneys, financial professionals, bankers, and investors who serve these clients.
About EisnerAmper India
EisnerAmper (India) Consultants Pvt. Ltd. (“EA India”) is a subsidiary of Eisner Advisory Group LLC (“EA Group”), which practices in an alternative practice structure with EisnerAmper LLP. EA India employees provide advisory services to clients of EA Group and audit services to clients of Eisner Amper LLP and comply with the professional standards applicable to each of EA India, EA Group and EisnerAmper LLP. EA India employees also provide operational services to EA Group and EisnerAmper LLP. The policies and procedures of EA India, including obligations of confidentiality and non-disclosure, apply to all services provided by EA India employees. All applicants are applying to positions for employment with EA India, and not EA Group or EisnerAmper LLP.
EA India opened its first office in Mumbai in 2007. Over the years, our India footprint has expanded to include offices in Bangalore and Hyderabad. We are a culturally diverse pool of over 500 professionals supporting our global clientele from a range of startups to Fortune 500 entities.
Should you need any accommodations to complete this application please email: indiata@eisneramper.com
Preferred Location:
Bangalore

title: Fundraising Manager
description:
We are searching for an experienced fundraising manager with excellent leadership skills and networking abilities.

The fundraising manager will be responsible for building good relationships with prospective investors and clients across

and drawing up plans to ensure annual targets are met. You should be well organized, proactive,

and have the ability to inspire those around you.

To be successful as a fundraising manager, you should stay informed on marketing strategies,

Fundraising Manager’s Responsibilities:

* Conducting research on fundraising opportunities.

title: Credit Associate
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

As a Credit Risk Associate, you help the firm grow its business in a responsible way by anticipating new and emerging risks and using your expert judgement to solve real-world challenges that impact our company, customers, and communities. You will be conducting Credit Analysis of Corporate clients in the Middle Markets team in Commercial Banking division. We are located in Bangalore and work with North America based Clients and Underwriters. Our work culture is all about thinking outside the box, challenging the status quo, and striving to be best-in-class. If you possess relevant work experience and are passionate about risk management, building stakeholder relationships and taking charge of your career development, you may be the perfect fit for our team.


Work timings: Starts at 1 p.m. IST to provide coverage to US team members




**Job responsibilities**

* Independently prepare credit analysis on assigned clients - covering macro-overview, industry/sector, business, financials – and recommend changes to credit ratings and amendments to facilities
* Complete annual reviews for assigned portfolio and work on prospect coverage, new client onboarding, new product onboarding, renewals and modifications of existing facilities
* Assist in negotiating and finalizing documentation (credit agreements and amendments)
* Build strong relationships and maintain open communication with colleagues from various Lines of Business including Underwriters, Bankers, Middle Office, etc.
* Support due diligence on capital market transactions for clients
* Develop strong working knowledge and track clients/sectors related to diversified industries on an on-going basis
* Ensure governance, reporting and data quality requirements are met and maintained for client and client families




**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**

* Graduate degree
* 3-5 years’ experience in credit risk analysis
* Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
* Strong communication & interpersonal skills; ability to effectively present analysis and build positive relationships with global stakeholders
* In depth understanding of financial statements, including ratio analysis, cash flow analysis and accounting standards
* Excellent academic record, strong grasp of corporate finance concepts and application, close attention to detail and accuracy
* Aptitude to learn and develop knowledge on credit analysis techniques, sectors and global economies
* Proficient in the use of MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint




**Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills**

* None


**ABOUT US**  

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  

  

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

  

  

  

**ABOUT THE TEAM**  


Commercial Banking is focused on helping our clients succeed and making a positive difference in our communities. We provide credit and financing, treasury and payment services, international banking and real estate services to clients including corporations, municipalities, institutions, real estate investors and owners, and nonprofit organizations.  

  

Risk Management helps the firm understand, manage and anticipate risks in a constantly changing environment. The work covers areas such as evaluating country-specific risk, understanding regulatory changes and determining credit worthiness. Risk Management provides independent oversight and maintains an effective control environment.

title: Finance Intern
description:
**Finance Intern**
==================


About Credy


Credy is a technology credit platform - we are building the operating system for financial services. We have built modular, plug-and-play APIs to help our partners underwrite and collect loans from end customers. In a highly credit underserved country with rapidly increasing smartphone adoption, we are enabling any company to become a fintech company through our suite of APIs and regulatory layer, and helping build customized financial products for "Middle India" and its 360 million customers - for consumption-based use cases, upskilling / education financing, medical financing, etc.
About Credy team


We are a fast growing young team of 30 driven people with engineering, credit, banking, and data science backgrounds. Our founding team consists of ex Goldman Sachs investment bankers with 21+ years experience. Credy is a Y Combinator backed startup and has financial backing from other prominent Silicon Valley investors like Khosla Ventures, Vy Capital, and domestic investors like MAS Financial.
We are looking to add passionate Financial Interns to our growing team.


What would you get to learn?


You can contribute to any space which will enable you to learn more about Financial domain.


Required Skills:

* The Finance Intern can expect to participate in the preparation of journal entries and financial reports, analyze actual financial data, learn more about bookkeeping, and assist with other accounting activities.
Responsibilities:

* Assisting with research, filing, data entry, and recording and maintaining accurate and complete financial records.
* Handle vendor payments and keep track of the payments from vendors.
* Create invoices for vendors and maintain copies of such invoices digitally.
* Make TDS and PT payments from time to time.
* Assist in calculating Mutual Funds Gains from time to time.
* Handling sensitive or confidential information with honesty and integrity.
* Assist in generating financial reports that display the company’s profits, equity and cash flow
* Assist with financial audits, GST filing and RBI filing as and when required.
Qualifications:

* Must be a recent graduate or actively working towards a Bachelor’s or Master’s in Accounting.
* Basic understanding of financial and accounting principles.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is a must.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* High level of efficiency, accuracy, and responsibility.
* This position requires visiting the office on a regular basis.
Perks:

* This is a paid internship for 6 months starting from October to March 2020.
* Internship Certificate.
* The skills are transferable. The skills you acquire will never be out of use.
* Comfortable Working Environment.
* Constant learning curve. You will only get better with passing time as you will be in sync with the technological changes.
* You can be as creative as you want.
* Professional development. Get opportunities for professional development, to master new skills and to grow into other roles.
What would you get to learn?

* You can contribute to any space which will enable you to learn more about Financial domain.
  

  

Lots of passion and hardworking nature is not an option! :)
